analyzed: de las byung ba 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni nye bar spyod pa can no //

original: nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba'o //üîΩyongs su spyod pa ni 'du shes //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba'o // yongs su spyod pa ni 'du shes //
translated: Experience is feeling.üîΩDiscrimination is the discrimination of objects.

original: rnam par shes pa 'jug par @3b byed pa dag ni 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'jug par @3b byed pa dag ni 'du byed rnams te /
translated: The motivating dispositions are the mental factors that engage with consciousness.

original: sems pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are intention, attention, and so on.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ston te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ston te /
translated: The characteristics of the afflictions are also taught.

original: sgrib pa'i phyir dang 'debs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgrib pa'i phyir dang 'debs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they obscure, because they plant,

original: khrid pa'i phyir dang kun 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: khrid pa'i phyir dang kun 'dzin phyir //
translated: because they lead, because they grasp,

original: rdzogs byed phyir dang gsum gcod phyir //
analyzed: rdzogs byed phyir dang gsum gcod phyir //
translated: because they complete, and because they cut off the three.

original: nye bar gcod phyir sdud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar gcod phyir sdud pa'i phyir //
translated: because of obscuring, because of accumulating,

original: sbyor ba'i phyir dang mngon du'i phyir //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i phyir dang mngon du'i phyir //
translated: because of connecting, because of manifesting,

original: sdug bsngal phyir ni 'gro nyon mongs //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir ni 'gro nyon mongs //
translated: because of suffering, beings are defiled.

original: rnam gsum rnam gnyis kyang nyon mongs //
analyzed: rnam gsum rnam gnyis kyang nyon mongs //
translated: The three are twofold defilement,

original: rnam bdun yang dag min rtog las //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam bdun yang dag min rtog las // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the seven are from unreal imagination.

original: de la sgrib pa'i phyir ni ma rig pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sgrib pa'i phyir ni ma rig pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, because of obscuring, because ignorance obstructs seeing things as they are in reality.

original: 'debs pa'i phyir ni 'du byed rnams kyis rnam par shes pa la las kyi bag chags 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'debs pa'i phyir ni 'du byed rnams kyis rnam par shes pa la las kyi bag chags 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of planting, because the formative forces plant the latent tendencies of action in consciousness.

original: khrid pa'i phyir ni rnam par shes pas skye ba'i gnas su phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khrid pa'i phyir ni rnam par shes pas skye ba'i gnas su phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of conducting, because consciousness conducts to the place of rebirth.

original: kun 'dzin phyir ni ming dang gzugs kyi lus so //
analyzed: kun 'dzin phyir ni ming dang gzugs kyi lus so //
translated: Because of grasping, because name/form grasps the body.

original: rdzogs byed phyir ni skye mched drug gis so //
analyzed: rdzogs byed phyir ni skye mched drug gis so //
translated: Because of completing, because the six sense bases complete the faculties.

original: gsum gcod phyir ni reg pas so //
analyzed: gsum gcod phyir ni reg pas so //
translated: Because of the three intersections, because contact intersects the three.

original: nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ni tshor bas so //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i phyir ni tshor bas so //
translated: Because of experiencing, because feeling experiences the results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.üîΩBecause of craving, because craving craves the various kinds of pleasure.üîΩBecause of grasping, because grasping grasps the objects of craving.üîΩBecause of becoming, because becoming brings forth the results of grasping.üîΩBecause of birth, because birth is the arising of name/form in the place of rebirth.üîΩBecause of aging, because aging causes the faculties to deteriorate.üîΩBecause of death, because death causes the aggregates to perish.üîΩBecause of sorrow, because one grieves over the loss of loved ones.üîΩBecause of lamentation, because one laments the loss of loved ones with cries of distress.üîΩBecause of suffering, because one suffers in the body.üîΩBecause of mental unease, because one is mentally uneasy in mind.üîΩBecause of frustration, because one is frustrated in both body and mind.üîΩBecause of defilement, because the five beginning with craving defile the root consciousness.

original: sdud pa'i phyir ni las kyis btab pa'i yang srid pa sred pas so //
analyzed: sdud pa'i phyir ni las kyis btab pa'i yang srid pa sred pas so //
translated: Craving is the cause of rebirth, since it is the cause of rebirth by the act of craving.

original: sbyor ba'i phyir ni len pa rnams kyis rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mthun par 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i phyir ni len pa rnams kyis rnam par shes pa skye ba dang mthun par 'dod pa la sogs pa rnams su'o //
translated: Clinging is the cause of the connection, since it is the cause of the connection of consciousness with the place of rebirth, such as a womb, by the act of clinging.

original: mngon du'i phyir ni las byas pa'i rnam par smin pa srid pas yang srid par 'byin par mngon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du'i phyir ni las byas pa'i rnam par smin pa srid pas yang srid par 'byin par mngon par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Becoming is the cause of the manifestation, since it is the cause of the manifestation of the rebirth that is projected by the act of becoming.

original: sdug bsngal phyir ni skye ba dang / rga shis 'gro ba rnams nyon mongs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal phyir ni skye ba dang / rga shis 'gro ba rnams nyon mongs par byed pa'o //
translated: Birth is the cause of the suffering of the process of becoming, since it is the cause of the affliction of beings in the lifecycle by the suffering of birth and the suffering of old age and death.üîΩMoreover,

original: de yang / rnam gsum rnam gnyis kyang nyon mongs //
analyzed: de yang / rnam gsum rnam gnyis kyang nyon mongs //
translated: the three, the two, and also the seven

original: rnam bdun yang dag min rtog las //
analyzed: rnam bdun yang dag min rtog las //
translated: are from unreal imagination.

original: rnam gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The three are the defilement of the afflictions, the defilement of actions, and the defilement of birth.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa rnams so //
translated: Among them, the defilement of the afflictions is ignorance, craving, and clinging.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed rnams dang sred pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'du byed rnams dang sred pa'o //
translated: The defilement of action is the formative forces and craving.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams so //
translated: The defilement of birth is the remaining limbs.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis ni rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis ni rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of defilement: the defilement of cause and the defilement of result.

original: de la rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag rnams kyis so //üîΩ'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs @4a * //
analyzed: de la rgyu'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag rnams kyis so // 'bras bu'i kun nas nyon mongs @4a * //
translated: The defilement of cause is by means of the limbs of the nature of moral defilement and action.

original: pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis so //
analyzed: pa ni yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis so //
translated: The defilement of result is by means of the remaining limbs.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun ni rgyu rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bdun ni rgyu rnam pa bdun te /
translated: There are seven kinds of defilement, which are the seven causes.

original: ma rig pa ni phyin ci log gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni phyin ci log gi rgyu'o //
translated: Ignorance is the cause of error.

original: 'du byed rnams ni 'bebs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni 'bebs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The formative forces are the cause of projection.

original: rnam par shes pa ni nye bar khrid pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni nye bar khrid pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Consciousness is the cause of guidance.

original: ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug ni kun 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug ni kun 'dzin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Name-and-form and the six sense-fields are the cause of retention.

original: reg pa dang tshor ba ni nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: reg pa dang tshor ba ni nye bar spyod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Contact and feeling are the cause of experience.

original: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ni sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa ni sdud pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Craving, grasping, and becoming are the cause of accumulation.

original: skye ba dang / rga shi ni skyo ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga shi ni skyo ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: Birth, old age, and death are the cause of distress.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di dag thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di dag thams cad ni yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: All these afflictions arise from unreal imagination.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa'i don bsdus pa ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs kyi mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa'i don bsdus pa ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / bsdu ba'i mtshan nyid dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i thabs kyi mtshan nyid dang /
translated: The meaning of unreal imagination is summarized in nine characteristics: the characteristic of existence, the characteristic of nonexistence, the characteristic of its own nature, the characteristic of its inclusion, the characteristic of the method of engaging with nonexistence,

original: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rnam grangs kyi mtshan nyid dang / 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: the characteristic of its differentiation, the characteristic of its synonyms, the characteristic of its engagement, and the characteristic of its affliction.

original: mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam pa dgu bstan pa'o //
translated: These are the nine characteristics that are taught.

original: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the imagination of what is unreal,

original: stong pa nyid ji ltar shes par bya ba de ston te /üîΩstong pa nyid ni mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ji ltar shes par bya ba de ston te / stong pa nyid ni mdor bsdu na //
translated: he now teaches how emptiness should be understood.üîΩEmptiness should be understoodüîΩin brief as having the characteristic of non-duality,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni rnam grangs dang // de yi don dang dbye ba dang // sgrub pa dag ste shes par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni rnam grangs dang // de yi don dang dbye ba dang // sgrub pa dag ste shes par bya // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: as having the characteristic of the absence of both the duality and the non-duality.

original: mtshan nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /üîΩgnyis dngos med dang dngos med pa'i //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ji ltar shes par bya zhe na / gnyis dngos med dang dngos med pa'i //
translated: How should the characteristic be understood?

original: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness isüîΩthe non-existence of the duality and the existence of that non-existence.

original: gnyis po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa de'i dngos po ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa dang / dngos po med pa de'i dngos po ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of emptiness is the non-existence of the duality of apprehended object and apprehending subject, and the existence of that non-existence.

original: de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid du yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the characteristic of emptiness is taught as the absence of an existent thing.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: What is the absence of an existent thing?

original: yod pa ma yin med pa'ang min //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin med pa'ang min //
translated: It is neither existent nor non-existent.

original: ji ltar yod pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not existent?

original: 'di ltar gnyis po de'i dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis po de'i dngos po med pa'o //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the duality.

original: ji ltar med pa yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it not non-existent?üîΩBecause of the existence of the non-existence of the duality.

original: 'di ltar gnyis po'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyis po'i dngos po med pa'i dngos po de ni stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Thus, the characteristic of emptiness is the non-existence of the duality and the existence of that non-existence.

original: de bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa dang / tha dad gcig pa'i mtshan nyid min //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa dang / tha dad gcig pa'i mtshan nyid min //
translated: Therefore, imagination of what is unreal is neither different nor not different from its own nature.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni chos la chos nyid gzhan ma yin pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni chos la chos nyid gzhan ma yin pa mi rung ste /
translated: If it were different, then the nature of dharmas would not be suitable as a dharma.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: It would be like impermanence and painfulness.

original: gcig pa yin du zin na ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyi'i @4b mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig pa yin du zin na ni rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa dang / spyi'i @4b mtshan nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not different, then the object of purification would not be a universal characteristic.

original: des de nyid dang gzhan las rnam par grol ba stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des de nyid dang gzhan las rnam par grol ba stong pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has taught the characteristic of emptiness, which is free from identity and difference.

original: rnam grangs ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand its synonyms?

original: stong pa nyid ni mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mdor bsdu na //
translated: Emptiness should be understood as

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag mtha' //
translated: Reality, the perfect end,üîΩsignlessness, the ultimate,

original: mtshan ma med dang don dam dang // chos kyi dbyings ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med dang don dam dang // chos kyi dbyings ni rnam grangs so //
translated: and the expanse of reality are synonyms.

original: rnam grangs kyi don ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi don ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the meaning of the synonyms be understood?

original: gzhan min phyin ci log ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan min phyin ci log ma yin //
translated: It is not other, nor is it erroneous,üîΩbecause it is the cessation of that, the domain of the ƒÅryas,

original: de 'gog 'phags pa'i spyod yul dang // 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: de 'gog 'phags pa'i spyod yul dang // 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yi phyir //
translated: and the cause of the ƒÅrya dharmas.

original: rnam grangs don de go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rnam grangs don de go rims bzhin //
translated: The meaning of the synonyms is in that order.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid de /
translated: It is reality because it is not other.

original: rtag tu de bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu de bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is always just that way.

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: It is the perfect end because it is not erroneous.

original: phyin ci log gi gzhi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi gzhi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the basis of error.

original: mtshan ma 'gog pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma 'gog pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: It is signlessness because it is the cessation of signs.

original: mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pas don dam pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad med pa'i phyir ro // 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pas don dam pa ste /
translated: It is the absence of all signs.üîΩIt is the ultimate because it is the domain of the wisdom of the ƒÅryas.

original: ye shes dam pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes dam pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the object of the highest wisdom.

original: 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings te ;
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu yin pas chos kyi dbyings te ;
translated: It is the dharma-dhƒÅtu, because it is the cause of the noble dharmas.

original: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni de la dmigs pas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos rnams ni de la dmigs pas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The noble dharmas arise by taking it as their object.

original: 'dir dbyings kyi don ni rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir dbyings kyi don ni rgyu'i don to //
translated: Here, the meaning of dhƒÅtu is the meaning of cause.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rab tu dbye ba ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the divisions of emptiness be understood?

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag / ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam par dag / ces bya ba ste /
translated: It is afflicted and purified.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ste //
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ste //
translated: Its divisions are

original: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa la /
translated: When it is afflicted,

original: gang gi tshe rnam par dag ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par dag ce na /
translated: when is it purified?

original: de ni dri bcas dri ma med //
analyzed: de ni dri bcas dri ma med //
translated: It is both stained and stainless.

original: gang gi tshe dri ma dang bcas par de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dri ma dang bcas par de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa gnas pa'o //
translated: When it is together with stains, then it is the abode of affliction.

original: gang gi tshe dri ma spangs pa de'i tshe rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dri ma spangs pa de'i tshe rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: When it is free from stains, then it is purified.

original: gal te dri ma dang bcas par gyur la dri ma med par yang 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pas ji ltar mi rtag par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dri ma dang bcas par gyur la dri ma med par yang 'gyur na 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pas ji ltar mi rtag par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it were sometimes together with stains and sometimes without stains, then since it would have the quality of change, how could it not be impermanent?

original: de ni 'di ltar ;
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar ;
translated: It is like this.

original: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
analyzed: chu khams gser dang nam mkha' rnams //
translated: The element of water, gold and space

original: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
analyzed: dag pa bzhin du dag par 'dod //
translated: are accepted as being pure in the same way.

original: glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba la bya'i de'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba la bya'i de'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúpurity‚Äù is the absence of adventitious defilements, not a transformation of the entity itself.

original: gzhan yang rab tu dbye ba ni stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug po 'di lta ste /üîΩnang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rab tu dbye ba ni stong pa nyid rnam pa bcu drug po 'di lta ste / nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: Moreover, the classification of emptiness is sixteenfold:üîΩemptiness of internal phenomena, emptiness of external phenomena, emptiness of external and internal phenomena, emptiness of emptiness, emptiness of great extent, emptiness of ultimate reality, emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

original: kun tu sbyor ba dgu ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba dgu ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'o //
translated: The nine fetters are the obscurations that consist in moral defilement.

original: de dag gang la gang sgrib ce na /
analyzed: de dag gang la gang sgrib ce na /
translated: What is it that they obscure?üîΩDisgust, equanimity,

original: skyo ba dang btang snyoms dang // de kho na ni mthong ba dang // rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni kun tu skyo ba la sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: skyo ba dang btang snyoms dang // de kho na ni mthong ba dang // rjes su chags pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni kun tu skyo ba la sgrib pa'o //
translated: and the vision of reality,

original: khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni btang snyoms la sgrib ste /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni btang snyoms la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of repugnance obscures equanimity,

original: des ni mi mthun @6b pa la khong khro ba'i gzhi la btang snyoms su byed mi nus so //
analyzed: des ni mi mthun @6b pa la khong khro ba'i gzhi la btang snyoms su byed mi nus so //
translated: for on account of it one is unable to be even-minded with regard to the basis of repugnance.

original: lhag ma rnams ni de kho na mthong ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni de kho na mthong ba la /
translated: The remaining ones obscure the vision of reality.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: de dag ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: They are respectively:üîΩThe view of individuality, the basis of that,üîΩcessation, the path, the jewels,üîΩgain and honour,

original: 'jig tshogs lta dang de'i gzhi dang // 'gog dang lam dang dkon mchog dang // rnyed pa dang ni bkur sti dang // yo byad bsnyungs pa yongs shes la //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs lta dang de'i gzhi dang // 'gog dang lam dang dkon mchog dang // rnyed pa dang ni bkur sti dang // yo byad bsnyungs pa yongs shes la //
translated: and the diminution of the accessories of enlightenment.

original: sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa yin no //
translated: They are obscurations.

original: nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes pa la sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun tu sbyor ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yongs su shes pa la sgrib pa ste /
translated: The fetter of pride obscures the full understanding of the view of individuality.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par kun tu 'byung ba'i dbang gis de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal bar chad dang bcas pa dang bar chad med par kun tu 'byung ba'i dbang gis de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of realization, the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am‚Äù arises with and without obstacles, and it is not abandoned.

original: ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gzhi yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i gzhi yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of ignorance is an obstruction to the thorough knowledge of the basis of the view of the transitory collection.

original: des nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the appropriated aggregates are not thoroughly known.

original: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of views is an obstruction to the thorough knowledge of the truth of cessation.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis kyis de la skrag pa dang / log par lta bas de la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis kyis de la skrag pa dang / log par lta bas de la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two views of the transitory collection and of grasping an extreme cause fear that truth, and wrong views deny it.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni lam gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ni lam gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of clinging is an obstruction to the thorough knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis mchog gi dag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis mchog gi dag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it clings to other aspects as being superior and pure.

original: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba ni dkon mchog gsum yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun tu sbyor ba ni dkon mchog gsum yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of doubt obscures the thorough knowledge of the Three Jewels,

original: de'i yon tan la mngon par yid mi ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yon tan la mngon par yid mi ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not have firm conviction in their virtues.

original: phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun tu sbyor ba ni rnyed pa dang / bkur sti yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of envy obscures the thorough knowledge of gain and honor,

original: de'i nyes pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nyes pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not see their faults.

original: ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba ni yo byad bsnyungs pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: ser sna'i kun tu sbyor ba ni yo byad bsnyungs pa yongs su shes pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The fetter of avarice obscures the thorough knowledge of fewness of wishes,

original: yo byad la lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdge la sogs pa bcu la gzhan //
analyzed: yo byad la lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro // dge la sogs pa bcu la gzhan //
translated: because one is attached to possessions.üîΩThe others are obscurations to virtue and so on.

original: dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu la sgrib pa gzhan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu la sgrib pa gzhan du rig par bya'o //
translated: The others should be understood as obscurations to the ten, such as virtue.

original: sgrib pa de ni gang /
analyzed: sgrib pa de ni gang /
translated: What are those obscurations?

original: dge ba la sogs pa ni gang zhe na /üîΩsbyor ba med dang skye mched min //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa ni gang zhe na / sbyor ba med dang skye mched min //
translated: What are the ten such as virtue?üîΩThey are:üîΩnonapplication, nonarising,

original: rnal 'byor min pas gang bskyed dang // skye ba med dang yid mi byed //
analyzed: rnal 'byor min pas gang bskyed dang // skye ba med dang yid mi byed //
translated: noncultivation, nonarising, nonattention,

original: tshogs ni rab tu ma rdzogs dang // rigs dang bshes gnyen mi ldan dang // sems ni yongs su skyo ba dang // sgrub pa dang yang mi ldan dang // skye bo ngan dang 'grogs pa dang // @7a * //
analyzed: tshogs ni rab tu ma rdzogs dang // rigs dang bshes gnyen mi ldan dang // sems ni yongs su skyo ba dang // sgrub pa dang yang mi ldan dang // skye bo ngan dang 'grogs pa dang // @7a * //
translated: 5. One associates with bad people,

original: rang gi gnas ngan len gsum las //
analyzed: rang gi gnas ngan len gsum las //
translated: 6. One has the three bad natures of oneself,üîΩ7. The rest are the immaturities of wisdom,

original: lhag ma shes rab ma smin dang // rang bzhin gyis ni gnas ngan len //
analyzed: lhag ma shes rab ma smin dang // rang bzhin gyis ni gnas ngan len //
translated: and the bad natures by nature.üîΩ8. Laziness,üîΩ9. Selflessness,üîΩ10. Attachment to existence and enjoyments,üîΩ11. The mind becomes depressed,üîΩ12. Lack of faith and lack of interest,üîΩ13. Analyzing according to the words,

original: le lo dang yang bdag med dang // srid dang longs spyod chags pa dang // sems ni zhum par gyur pa dang // ma dad pa dang ma mos dang ; / sgra bzhin du ni dpyod pa dang // dam chos ched cher mi 'dzin dang //
analyzed: le lo dang yang bdag med dang // srid dang longs spyod chags pa dang // sems ni zhum par gyur pa dang // ma dad pa dang ma mos dang ; / sgra bzhin du ni dpyod pa dang // dam chos ched cher mi 'dzin dang //
translated: 14. Not holding the holy Dharma as supreme,

original: rnyed la gdu dang snying rje med //
analyzed: rnyed la gdu dang snying rje med //
translated: 15. Greed for gain and lack of compassion,üîΩ16. Lack of learning and little learning,

original: thos pas phongs dang nyung ba dang // ting 'dzin skyangs pa ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: thos pas phongs dang nyung ba dang // ting 'dzin skyangs pa ma byas pa'o //
translated: 17. Not maintaining meditative stabilization.

original: de dag ni sgrib pa'o //üîΩdge ba la sogs pa gang zhe na //
analyzed: de dag ni sgrib pa'o // dge ba la sogs pa gang zhe na //
translated: These are the obscurations.üîΩWhat is virtue, etc.?

original: dge dang byang chub yang dag 'dzin //
analyzed: dge dang byang chub yang dag 'dzin //
translated: Virtue, and the correct holding of enlightenment,

original: blo ldan 'khrul med sgrib pa med //
analyzed: blo ldan 'khrul med sgrib pa med //
translated: The wise are unmistaken and unobstructed.

original: bsngo dang mi skrag ser sna med //
analyzed: bsngo dang mi skrag ser sna med //
translated: They are dedicated, fearless, and not stingy.

original: dbang ni dge la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ni dge la sogs pa'o //
translated: They have power over virtue and so forth.üîΩWhat are the obscurations to these virtues and so forth?

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdge ba la sogs pa 'di dag la gang gang la sgrib pa du yod par shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // dge ba la sogs pa 'di dag la gang gang la sgrib pa du yod par shes par bya zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: de dag gi ni sgrib pa rnams //
analyzed: de dag gi ni sgrib pa rnams //
translated: Their obscurations

original: gsum gsum dag tu shes par bya //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gsum gsum dag tu shes par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: should be understood as threefold.

original: dge ba la sgrib pa gsum ni sbyor ba med pa dang / skye mched ma yin pa la sbyor ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sgrib pa gsum ni sbyor ba med pa dang / skye mched ma yin pa la sbyor ba dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The three obscurations to virtue are: not applying oneself, applying oneself to what is not the spiritual levels, and applying oneself incorrectly.

original: byang chub kyi sgrib pa gsum ni dge ba mi bskyed pa dang / yid la mi byed pa dang / tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sgrib pa gsum ni dge ba mi bskyed pa dang / yid la mi byed pa dang / tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The three obscurations to enlightenment are: not producing virtue, not attending to it, and not completing the collections.

original: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin pa ni byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: Correctly taking up is the generation of the will to enlightenment.

original: de'i sgrib pa gsum ni rigs dang mi ldan pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mi ldan pa dang / sems yongs su skyo ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa gsum ni rigs dang mi ldan pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mi ldan pa dang / sems yongs su skyo ba'o //
translated: The three obscurations to that are: not having the lineage, not having a spiritual teacher, and being discouraged.

original: blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid de /
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid de /
translated: The wise one is the bodhisattva himself.

original: de'i rab tu shes pa la sgrib pa gsum ni sgrub pa dang mi ldan pa dang / skye bo ngan pa dang 'grogs pa dang / skye bo sdang ba dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rab tu shes pa la sgrib pa gsum ni sgrub pa dang mi ldan pa dang / skye bo ngan pa dang 'grogs pa dang / skye bo sdang ba dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: The three obscurations to his knowledge are: lack of practice, association with bad people, and association with hostile people.

original: de la skye bo ngan pa ni skye bo blun pa'o //
analyzed: de la skye bo ngan pa ni skye bo blun pa'o //
translated: Among them, bad people are foolish people.

original: skye bo sdang ba ni zhe 'gras pa rnams so //
analyzed: skye bo sdang ba ni zhe 'gras pa rnams so //
translated: Hostile people are those who are hostile.

original: 'khrul pa med pa la sgrib pa gsum ni phyin ci log gi gnas ngan len dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa gsum las lhag ma gang yang rung ba dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su ma smin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa la sgrib pa gsum ni phyin ci log gi gnas ngan len dang / nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa gsum las lhag ma gang yang rung ba dang / rnam par grol ba yongs su smin par byed pa'i shes rab yongs su ma smin pa'o //
translated: The three obscurations to non-error are: the negative reflex action of error, any remaining one of the three obscurations such as the afflictions, and the unripeness of the wisdom that ripens complete liberation.

original: sgrib pa spangs pa ni sgrib pa med pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs pa ni sgrib pa med pa ste /
translated: The absence of obscurations is the abandonment of obscurations.

original: de la sgrib @7b pa gsum ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas ngan len dang / le lo dang bag med pa'o //
analyzed: de la sgrib @7b pa gsum ni lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas ngan len dang / le lo dang bag med pa'o //
translated: The three obscurations to that are: the negative reflex action that is innate, laziness, and carelessness.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sgrib pa gsum ni gang dag gis sems gzhan du yongs su sngo bar byed kyi /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sgrib pa gsum ni gang dag gis sems gzhan du yongs su sngo bar byed kyi /
translated: The three obscurations to complete transformation are those by which the mind is completely transformed elsewhere,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ni yongs su mi bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ni yongs su mi bsngo ba ste /
translated: but not completely transformed into unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: srid pa la chags pa dang / longs spyod la chags pa dang / sems zhum pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa la chags pa dang / longs spyod la chags pa dang / sems zhum pa'o //
translated: They are: attachment to existence, attachment to enjoyments, and a depressed mind.

original: mi skrag pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni gang zag la mi srid snyam pa dang / chos la mi mos pa dang / don la sgra ji bzhin du dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi skrag pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni gang zag la mi srid snyam pa dang / chos la mi mos pa dang / don la sgra ji bzhin du dpyod pa'o //
translated: The three obscurations to fearlessness are: thinking that it is impossible for a person, lack of interest in the Dharma, and literal analysis of the meaning.

original: ser sna med pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni dam pa'i chos la ched cher mi 'dzin pa dang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / mchod pa la ched cher 'dzin pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje med pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna med pa'i sgrib pa gsum ni dam pa'i chos la ched cher mi 'dzin pa dang rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / mchod pa la ched cher 'dzin pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje med pa'o //
translated: The three obscurations to non-stinginess are: not regarding the holy Dharma as important, regarding gain, honor, and offerings as important, and lack of compassion for sentient beings.

original: dbang gi sgrib pa gsum ni /
analyzed: dbang gi sgrib pa gsum ni /
translated: The three obscurations to power are:

original: gang dag gis dbang byed pa mi 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis dbang byed pa mi 'thob pa ste /
translated: those by which one does not attain power.

original: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las bskyed pas thos pas phongs pa dang / thos pas nyung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las bskyed pas thos pas phongs pa dang / thos pas nyung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa'o //
translated: The cause of the loss of Dharma is the generation of the karma that leads to the loss of Dharma, the loss of learning, the lack of learning, and the lack of training in samadhi.

original: sgrib pa 'di ni dge ba la sogs pa don gang la byed rgyu bcur 'gyur ba don de'i skabs kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa 'di ni dge ba la sogs pa don gang la byed rgyu bcur 'gyur ba don de'i skabs kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: This obscuration should be understood in terms of the context of the meaning of virtue and so on, in which it becomes the ten causes.

original: byed rgyu bcu la 'byung ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed rgyu bcu la 'byung ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i mig la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The ten causes are as follows: The cause of arising is, for example, the eyes and so on for the eye consciousness and so on.

original: gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na sems can rnams kyi zas bzhi lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na sems can rnams kyi zas bzhi lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of abiding is, for example, the four foods for sentient beings.

original: rten pa'i byed rgyu ni gang gi gnas su gang gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rten pa'i byed rgyu ni gang gi gnas su gang gyur pa ste /
translated: The cause of support is that which becomes the abode of something,

original: dper na sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi snod kyi 'jig rten lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the world of the environment for the world of sentient beings.

original: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na gzugs kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na gzugs kyi snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: The cause of manifestation is, for example, light for form.

original: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na btso ba la sogs pa'i me la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na btso ba la sogs pa'i me la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The productive cause is, for example, fire, etc. for cooking, etc.

original: 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na brda bar bya ba la sogs pa'i zor ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'bral ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na brda bar bya ba la sogs pa'i zor ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The separating cause is, for example, a sickle, etc. for cutting, etc.

original: sgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na gser la sogs pa'i gser mgar la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sgyur ba'i byed rgyu ni dper na gser la sogs pa'i gser mgar la sogs pa lta bu ste /
translated: The transforming cause is, for example, a goldsmith, etc. for transforming gold, etc.

original: gang bu la sogs pa'i dngos por bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang bu la sogs pa'i dngos por bsgyur ba'o //
translated: into bracelets, etc.

original: yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na me la sogs pa'i du ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid ches pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na me la sogs pa'i du ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The convincing cause is, for example, smoke, etc. for fire, etc.

original: yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs lta bu'o //üîΩ'thob pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na mya ngan las @8a * //
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na dam bcas pa dang gtan tshigs lta bu'o // 'thob pa'i byed rgyu ni dper na mya ngan las @8a * //
translated: The convincing-making cause is, for example, a promise and a reason.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i lam la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i lam la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The attaining cause is, for example, the path, etc. for nirvana, etc.

original: de bzhin du skye ba la sgrib pa ni dge ba la sgrib pa ste de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba la sgrib pa ni dge ba la sgrib pa ste de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, the obscuration to arising is the obscuration to virtue, because it is to be generated.

original: gnas pa la sgrib pa ni byang chub la sgrib ste de mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa la sgrib pa ni byang chub la sgrib ste de mi 'khrugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Obscuration to stability is an obscuration to enlightenment, because that is unshakable.

original: rten gyi sgrib pa ni yang dag par 'dzin pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: rten gyi sgrib pa ni yang dag par 'dzin pa la sgrib ste /
translated: Obscuration to the basis is an obscuration to the correct grasp,

original: byang chub kyi sems gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gzhir gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the thought of enlightenment is the basis.

original: gsal ba la sgrib pa ni blo dang ldan pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: gsal ba la sgrib pa ni blo dang ldan pa la sgrib ste /
translated: Obscuration to manifestation is an obscuration to the wise,

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is to be revealed.

original: 'gyur ba la sgrib pa ni 'khrul pa med pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba la sgrib pa ni 'khrul pa med pa la sgrib ste /
translated: Obscuration to transformation is an obscuration to the absence of error,

original: de ni 'khrul pa ldog pas 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa ldog pas 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the transformation of the reversal of error.

original: 'bral ba la sgrib pa ni sgrib pa med pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: 'bral ba la sgrib pa ni sgrib pa med pa la sgrib ste /
translated: Obscuration to separation is an obscuration to the absence of obscuration,

original: de'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is separated from its obscuration.

original: sgyur ba la sgrib pa ni bsngo ba la sgrib ste /
analyzed: sgyur ba la sgrib pa ni bsngo ba la sgrib ste /
translated: Obscuration to transformation is an obscuration to the transformation,

original: byang chub tu sems yongs su bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems yongs su bsngo ba'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is characterized by the transformation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: yid ches pa la sgrib pa ni mi skrag pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa la sgrib pa ni mi skrag pa la sgrib ste /
translated: Obscuration to confidence is an obscuration to fearlessness,

original: yid mi ches pas skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid mi ches pas skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is fearful due to lack of confidence.

original: yid ches par byed pa la sgrib pa ni ser sna med pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa la sgrib pa ni ser sna med pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The obscuration to inspiring confidence is the obscuration to non-avarice,

original: chos la ser sna med pas gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la ser sna med pas gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one inspires confidence in others through non-avarice in regard to the Dharma.

original: thob pa la sgrib pa ni dbang la sgrib ste /
analyzed: thob pa la sgrib pa ni dbang la sgrib ste /
translated: The obscuration to attainment is the obscuration to mastery,

original: dbang byed pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang byed pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because mastery is characterized by attainment.üîΩThe ten causes are:üîΩarising, enduring, support, manifestation,üîΩchange, separation, transformation,

original: byed rgyu bcu ni skye ba dang // gnas pa rten dang bstan bya dang // 'gyur dang 'bral dang gzhan du dang // yid ches go 'byed 'thob rnams la //
analyzed: byed rgyu bcu ni skye ba dang // gnas pa rten dang bstan bya dang // 'gyur dang 'bral dang gzhan du dang // yid ches go 'byed 'thob rnams la //
translated: confidence, opportunity, and attainment.üîΩThe examples for these are:

original: mig dang zas sa mar me dang // me la sogs pa de yi dpe //
analyzed: mig dang zas sa mar me dang // me la sogs pa de yi dpe //
translated: the eye, food, the earth, a mother, a fire,üîΩand so on.üîΩOther examples are:üîΩa sickle, a craftsman, smoke,

original: zor ba bzo shes du ba dang // rgyu dang lam la sogs pa gzhan //
analyzed: zor ba bzo shes du ba dang // rgyu dang lam la sogs pa gzhan //
translated: a cause, a path, and so on.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te /üîΩbyang chub thob par 'dod pas thog ma nyid du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i go rims ni 'di yin te / byang chub thob par 'dod pas thog ma nyid du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: The order of virtue and so on is as follows:üîΩOne who desires to attain enlightenment should first generate the roots of virtue.

original: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed na byang chub thob par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed na byang chub thob par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should attain enlightenment by developing the power of the roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa de'i gnas ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa de'i gnas ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The basis of the generation of the wholesome roots is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi sems de'i gnas ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de'i gnas ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The basis of the Thought of Enlightenment is the Bodhisattva.

original: byang chub kyi sems bskyed de /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bskyed de /
translated: Having generated the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des phyin ci log spang ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs bskyed pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' des phyin ci log spang ba'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa bskyed par bya'o //
translated: the Bodhisattva who has attained the power of the generation of the wholesome roots should generate the non-erroneous in order to abandon the erroneous.

original: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam la phyin ci ma log pas bsgom @8b pa'i lam gyi sgrib pa thams cad spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mthong ba'i lam la phyin ci ma log pas bsgom @8b pa'i lam gyi sgrib pa thams cad spang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, by means of the non-erroneous on the path of vision, he should abandon all the obscurations of the path of cultivation.

original: sgrib pa spangs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs nas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o //
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations, he should dedicate all the wholesome roots to the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i 'og tu bsngo ba'i stobs bskyed nas chos zab cing rgya che ba bstan pa dag la mi skrag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsngo ba'i stobs bskyed nas chos zab cing rgya che ba bstan pa dag la mi skrag par bya'o //
translated: Then, having generated the power of the dedication, he should not be afraid of the teachings of the profound and the vast.

original: de ltar mi skrag pa'i yid kyis chos rnams kyi yon tan mthong nas gzhan dag la chos de dag rgya cher yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi skrag pa'i yid kyis chos rnams kyi yon tan mthong nas gzhan dag la chos de dag rgya cher yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, with a mind that is not afraid, having seen the virtues of the teachings, one should teach those teachings to others in an extensive way.

original: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yon tan sna tshogs kyi stobs bskyed pa thob pa de myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob nas chos thams cad la dbang 'thob po //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yon tan sna tshogs kyi stobs bskyed pa thob pa de myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob nas chos thams cad la dbang 'thob po //
translated: After that, the bodhisattva who has attained the power of various virtues quickly attains unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and attains mastery over all phenomena.

original: phyogs dang pha rol phyin sa la //
analyzed: phyogs dang pha rol phyin sa la //
translated: Obstructions to the perfections, levels, and so on

original: sgrib pa dag ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa dag ni gzhan yin no //
translated: are different from those to the factors of enlightenment.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la sgrib pa ni /
translated: The obstructions to the factors of enlightenment areüîΩlack of skill in the bases, laziness,üîΩtwo that weaken concentration,üîΩnonarising, weakness,

original: gzhi la mi mkhas le lo dang // gnyis kyis ting 'dzin nyams pa dang // mi skyed pa dang nyam chung dang // lta dang gnas ngan len skyon chags //
analyzed: gzhi la mi mkhas le lo dang // gnyis kyis ting 'dzin nyams pa dang // mi skyed pa dang nyam chung dang // lta dang gnas ngan len skyon chags //
translated: and faults of attachment to view and to bad states.

original: gzhi la mi mkhas pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sgrib po //
analyzed: gzhi la mi mkhas pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la sgrib po //
translated: Lack of skill in the bases is an obstruction to the establishments of mindfulness.

original: le lo ni yang dag par spong ba rnams la sgrib po //
analyzed: le lo ni yang dag par spong ba rnams la sgrib po //
translated: Laziness is an obscuration in the case of the correct exertions.

original: gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang sems pa dang / dpyod pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang bas yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / spong ba'i 'du byed bsgom pa ma tshang bas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la sgrib po //
analyzed: gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin nyams pa ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang sems pa dang / dpyod pa rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang bas yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / spong ba'i 'du byed bsgom pa ma tshang bas rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la sgrib po //
translated: The degeneration of concentration in the case of the bases of psychic power is an obscuration since it is incomplete due to the deficiency of any one of the four: will, vigour, effort or investigation, or due to the deficiency of the meditation on the formative forces of abandonment.

original: thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnams mi skyed ba ni dbang po rnams la sgrib po //
analyzed: thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa rnams mi skyed ba ni dbang po rnams la sgrib po //
translated: The non-generation of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is an obscuration in the case of the faculties.

original: dbang po de dag nyam chung ba ni stobs rnams la sgrib ste /
analyzed: dbang po de dag nyam chung ba ni stobs rnams la sgrib ste /
translated: The weakness of the faculties is an obscuration in the case of the powers.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the latter are not overwhelmed by adverse elements because they are not intermixed with adverse elements.

original: lta ba'i nyes pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la sgrib ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i nyes pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams la sgrib ste /
translated: The fault of view is an obscuration in the case of the limbs of enlightenment.

original: de dag mthong ba'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag mthong ba'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, these are distinguished by the path of vision.

original: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa ni lam gyi yan lag rnams la sgrib ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi nyes pa ni lam gyi yan lag rnams la sgrib ste /
translated: The fault of negative instinct is an obscuration in the case of the limbs of the path.

original: de dag bsgom pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bsgom pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are distinguished by the path of meditation.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib pa ni /
translated: The obscurations to the perfections are:üîΩThe obscurations to the perfections are described as follows:üîΩThe obscurations to the perfection of generosity are:üîΩpoverty, rebirth in unfortunate states of existence,üîΩnot giving up on sentient beings,

original: phyug po dang ni bde 'gro dang // sems can mi gtong sgrib pa dang // nyes pa dag dang yon tan rnams //
analyzed: phyug po dang ni bde 'gro dang // sems can mi gtong sgrib pa dang // nyes pa dag dang yon tan rnams //
translated: faults, virtues,üîΩdiminution, increase,

original: 'bri dang 'phel dang 'dzud pa dang // grol bar byed dang @9a * //
analyzed: 'bri dang 'phel dang 'dzud pa dang // grol bar byed dang @9a * //
translated: engaging,üîΩnot exhausting,üîΩthe uninterrupted continuity of virtue,

original: mi zad dang // dge ba rgyun mi 'chad pa dang // nges par byed dang chos rnams la //
analyzed: mi zad dang // dge ba rgyun mi 'chad pa dang // nges par byed dang chos rnams la //
translated: certainty,üîΩenjoying the Dharma,

original: longs par spyod dang yongs smin byed //
analyzed: longs par spyod dang yongs smin byed //
translated: and bringing to maturity.

original: 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de la sgrib pas de'i sgrib pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag ni pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi 'bras bu gang yin pa de la sgrib pas de'i sgrib pa zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The ten perfections are described as the obscurations to the result of whatever perfection.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu phyug po dang / bdag po la sgrib pas sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu phyug po dang / bdag po la sgrib pas sgrib pa'o //
translated: The obscurations to the perfection of generosity are poverty and rebirth in unfortunate states of existence.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu bde 'gro la sgrib po //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu bde 'gro la sgrib po //
translated: The obscurations to the perfection of morality are rebirth in unfortunate states of existence.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu sems can yongs su mi gtong ba la sgrib po //
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu sems can yongs su mi gtong ba la sgrib po //
translated: The result of the perfection of patience is the non-abandonment of beings.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu nyes pa dang yon tan 'bri zhing 'phel ba la sgrib po //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu nyes pa dang yon tan 'bri zhing 'phel ba la sgrib po //
translated: The result of the perfection of effort is the increase of good qualities and the decrease of faults.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu gdul bya 'jud pa la sgrib po //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu gdul bya 'jud pa la sgrib po //
translated: The result of the perfection of meditation is the entry of those to be trained.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par grol bar byed pa la sgrib po //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par grol bar byed pa la sgrib po //
translated: The result of the perfection of wisdom is the liberation of those to be trained.

original: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The result of the perfection of skillful means is the inexhaustibility of generosity and so forth.

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pas de mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pas de mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is dedicated to enlightenment, it is inexhaustible.

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu tshe rabs thams cad du dge ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba la sgrib ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu tshe rabs thams cad du dge ba rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba la sgrib ste /
translated: The result of the perfection of aspiration is the uninterrupted arising of virtue in all lives.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis de dang mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis de dang mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because through the power of aspiration, one takes birth in accordance with it.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu dge ba de nyid nges par byed pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu dge ba de nyid nges par byed pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The result of the perfection of strength is the obscuration to the definite attainment of that very virtue,

original: so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa dang bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi gnon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of analysis and meditation cannot be overwhelmed by adverse elements.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu bdag dang gzhan chos la longs spyod pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa la sgrib ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu bdag dang gzhan chos la longs spyod pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa la sgrib ste /
translated: The result of the perfection of wisdom is the obscuration to the enjoyment of the Dharma for oneself and for others and to the maturation of beings,

original: thos pa'i don sgra ji bzhin ma yin par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i don sgra ji bzhin ma yin par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not understand the meaning of what one has heard as it truly is.

analyzed: sa rnams la yang go rims bzhin te /

original: kun tu 'gro don mchog gi don //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro don mchog gi don //
translated: The universal vehicle is to be understood as having ten universal characteristics.üîΩThe universal vehicle is to be understood as having ten universal characteristics.üîΩThe universal vehicle is to be understood as having ten universal characteristics.üîΩThe universal vehicle is to be understood as having ten universal characteristics.üîΩThe universal vehicle is to be understood as having ten universal characteristics.
