translated: The universal vehicle is to be understood as having ten universal characteristics.üîΩThe universal vehicle is to be understood as having ten universal characteristics.üîΩThe universal vehicle is to

original: chos kyi dbyings la ma rig pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ma rig pa //
translated: The dharmadhatu is the object of the ten universal states of mind, etc.

original: nyon mongs can min sgrib pa bcu //üîΩsa bcu'i @9b mi mthun phyogs rnams kyi //
analyzed: nyon mongs can min sgrib pa bcu // sa bcu'i @9b mi mthun phyogs rnams kyi //
translated: The ten obscurations are not afflicted.

original: gnyen po dag ni sa yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po dag ni sa yin no //
translated: The ten stages are the antidotes to the resistances to those.üîΩThe ten universal states of mind, etc., are the object of the dharmadhatu. The ten obscurations are not afflicted.

original: kun tu 'gro ba'i don la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la go rims bzhin du sgrib ste /üîΩde'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu 'gro ba'i don la sogs pa'i chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu la nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu la go rims bzhin du sgrib ste / de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are obscurations to the ten bodhisattva stages, respectively, because they are adverse to them.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sa dang po la ni chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don la kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs te /
analyzed: sa dang po la ni chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba'i don la kun tu 'gro ba'i don du rtogs te /
translated: On the first stage, the bodhisattva realizes the universal object of the dharmadhatu as universal,

original: des bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob po //
analyzed: des bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob po //
translated: and thereby attains the sameness of self and others.

original: gnyis pa la ni mchog gi don du rtogs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni mchog gi don du rtogs te /
translated: On the second stage, he realizes the supreme object of the dharmadhatu as supreme,

original: des 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: des 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: and thinks as follows:

original: de lta bas na bsgrub tu mtshungs pa la bdag gis rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyong ba mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la mngon par brtson par bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsgrub tu mtshungs pa la bdag gis rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyong ba mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la mngon par brtson par bya'o snyam mo //
translated: Therefore, in the same way that I have undertaken the practice of the perfection of generosity, I will strive to accomplish the practice of all the perfections in every way.

original: gsum pa la ni de'i rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog tu rtogs te /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni de'i rgyu mthun pa don gyi mchog tu rtogs te /
translated: In the third, he realizes the supreme meaning of the natural outcome of that.

original: des chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa thos pa mchog tu rig nas /
analyzed: des chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun pa thos pa mchog tu rig nas /
translated: Having understood the supreme meaning of the natural outcome of the realm of reality,

original: de'i phyir me'i 'obs stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i tshad tsam du yang bdag nyid mchod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir me'i 'obs stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i tshad tsam du yang bdag nyid mchod do //
translated: he offers himself into the fire pit, which is the size of the great trichiliocosm.

original: bzhi pa la ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don du rtogs te /
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i don du rtogs te /
translated: In the fourth, he realizes the meaning of non-grasping.

original: 'di ltar chos la sred pa la yang ldog go //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos la sred pa la yang ldog go //
translated: In this way, he turns away from craving for the Dharma.

original: lnga pa la ni rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i don du rtogs te /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni rgyud tha dad pa med pa'i don du rtogs te /
translated: In the fifth, he realizes the meaning of the absence of a separate continuum.

original: sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid rnam pa bcus rtogs so //
analyzed: sems dang bsam pa rnam par dag pa mnyam pa nyid rnam pa bcus rtogs so //
translated: He realizes this through the ten equalities of pure mind and intention.

original: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i don du rtogs te /
analyzed: drug pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa ma yin pa'i don du rtogs te /
translated: In the sixth, he realizes the meaning of neither affliction nor purification.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don la gang kun nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i chos de gang yin yang med par rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don la gang kun nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'am rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i chos de gang yin yang med par rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he fully understands that there is no dharma whatsoever that would be defiled or purified in the meaning of dependent origination.

original: bdun pa la ni tha dad pa med pa'i don du rtogs te /
analyzed: bdun pa la ni tha dad pa med pa'i don du rtogs te /
translated: On the seventh, he understands the meaning of non-differentiation,

original: mtshan ma med pas mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma tha dad par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pas mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma tha dad par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the signs of the Dharma such as the sutras do not occur as different due to signlessness.

original: brgyad pa la ni bri ba med cing 'phel ba med pa'i don du rtogs te /üîΩmi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: brgyad pa la ni bri ba med cing 'phel ba med pa'i don du rtogs te / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: On the eighth, he understands the meaning of non-decrease and non-increase,

original: rnam par byang ba na yang bri ba'am 'phel ba mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba na yang bri ba'am 'phel ba mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because when there is defilement or purification, he does not see any decrease or increase due to attaining forbearance with respect to the non-arising of dharmas.

original: dbang rnam pa bzhi ni rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba dang / zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: dbang rnam pa bzhi ni rnam par mi rtog pa la dbang ba dang / zhing yongs su dag pa la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / las la dbang ba'o //
translated: The four masteries are: mastery over non-conceptuality, mastery over the complete purification of the field, mastery over intuition, and mastery over karma.

original: de las brgyad pa nyid la chos kyi @10a * //
analyzed: de las brgyad pa nyid la chos kyi @10a * //
translated: Of these, on the eighth he attains mastery over non-conceptuality,

original: dbyings la dbang ba dang po dang / 'og gi gnas nyid du rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: dbyings la dbang ba dang po dang / 'og gi gnas nyid du rab tu rtogs so //
translated: The first is the basis of mastery over the realm, and the ninth is the basis of mastery over knowledge.

original: dgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: dgu pa la ni ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas nyid du rtogs te /
translated: The ninth is the basis of mastery over knowledge,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one obtains the analytical knowledges.

original: bcu pa la ni las la dbang ba'i gnas nyid du rtogs te /
analyzed: bcu pa la ni las la dbang ba'i gnas nyid du rtogs te /
translated: The tenth is the basis of mastery over action,

original: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du sprul pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du sprul pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one acts for the benefit of beings by means of emanations as one wishes.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: nyon mongs pa yi sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa nyid du bstan //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yi sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa nyid du bstan //
translated: the obscurations are said to be the afflictive and the knowledge.

original: der ni sgrib pa thams cad de //
analyzed: der ni sgrib pa thams cad de //
translated: All obscurations are included in these two,

original: de zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
analyzed: de zad nas ni grol bar 'dod //
translated: and one is considered liberated by their destruction.

original: sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di zad na sgrib pa thams cad las grol bar 'dod do //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam pa gnyis po 'di zad na sgrib pa thams cad las grol bar 'dod do //
translated: One is considered liberated by the destruction of these two kinds of obscurations.

original: sgrib pa rnams kyi don bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa rnams kyi don bsdus pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the obscurations is summarized:

original: sgrib pa chen po ni khyab pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa chen po ni khyab pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The great obscurations are those that are pervasive.

original: sgrib pa chung ngu ni nye tshe pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa chung ngu ni nye tshe pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The small obscurations are those that are limited.

original: sbyor ba'i sgrib pa ni lhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sgrib pa ni lhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to application is any excess.

original: thob pa la sgrib pa ni mnyam pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa la sgrib pa ni mnyam pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to attainment is any equality.

original: 'thob pa khyad par can la sgrib pa ni len pa dang spong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa khyad par can la sgrib pa ni len pa dang spong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to the special attainment is any acceptance or rejection.

original: yang dag par sbyor ba la sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam pa dgu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor ba la sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam pa dgu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to right application is any of the nine kinds of obscuration to the afflicted view of the self, etc.

original: rgyu la sgrib pa ni dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu la sgrib pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu la sgrib pa ni dge ba la sogs pa rnam pa bcu la sgrib pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The obscuration to the cause is any obscuration to the ten kinds of virtue, etc.

original: rgyu'i don gyi skabs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i don gyi skabs kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of cause is the occasion.

original: de kho na la 'jug pa la sgrib pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na la 'jug pa la sgrib pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to the entry into reality is any obscuration to the elements that lead to enlightenment.

original: dge ba bla na med pa la sgrib pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba bla na med pa la sgrib pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to the highest virtue is any obscuration to the perfections.

original: de khyad par du 'gro ba la sgrib pa ni sa rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de khyad par du 'gro ba la sgrib pa ni sa rnams la sgrib pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The obscuration to the special progress is any obscuration to the stages.

original: bsdus pa'i sgrib pa ni mdor bsdus pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa'o //üîΩbstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las sgrib pa'i le'ur bcad pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o /üîΩ// / de kho na'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa /üîΩrtsa ba mtshan nyid de kho na //üîΩphyin ci ma log mtshan nyid dang // 'bras bu rgyu yi de kho na //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i sgrib pa ni mdor bsdus pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa'o // bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las sgrib pa'i le'ur bcad pa zhes bya ba gnyis pa'i 'grel pa'o / // / de kho na'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa / rtsa ba mtshan nyid de kho na // phyin ci ma log mtshan nyid dang // 'bras bu rgyu yi de kho na //
translated: The concise obscurations are the two concise types.

original: rags pa dang ni phra ba dang // grags dang rnam par dag yul dang // bsdu dang dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang // mkhas de kho na rnam bcu ni //üîΩbdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'o //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di dag ni de kho na rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rags pa dang ni phra ba dang // grags dang rnam par dag yul dang // bsdu dang dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang // mkhas de kho na rnam bcu ni // bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po'o // zhes bya ba 'di dag ni de kho na rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: This is the commentary on the second chapter, having sixteen verses, called ‚Äúthe obscurations.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.üîΩüîΩ

original: rtsa ba'i @10b de kho na dang / mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na dang / rags pa dang phra ba'i de kho na dang / grags pa'i de kho na dang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i @10b de kho na dang / mtshan nyid kyi de kho na dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu'i de kho na dang / rags pa dang phra ba'i de kho na dang / grags pa'i de kho na dang /
translated: The reality of the root, the reality of characteristics, the reality of non-error, the reality of effects and causes, the reality of the coarse and subtle, the reality of what is renowned,

original: rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / bsdu ba'i de kho na dang / rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na dang / mkhas pa'i de kho na ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na dang / bsdu ba'i de kho na dang / rab tu dbye ba'i de kho na dang / mkhas pa'i de kho na ste /
translated: the reality of the domain of purification, the reality of inclusion, the reality of differentiation, and the reality of expertise.

original: rnam pa bcu po de yang bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po de yang bdag tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: Those ten aspects should be known as the antidotes to the ten types of self-grasping.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / dbang po la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas pa dang / dbang po la mkhas pa dang /
translated: Expertise in the aggregates, expertise in the constituents, expertise in the sources, expertise in dependent origination, expertise in what is possible and impossible, expertise in the faculties,

original: dus la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la mkhas pa dang / theg pa la mkhas pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dus la mkhas pa dang / bden pa la mkhas pa dang / theg pa la mkhas pa dang / 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos la mkhas pa'o //
translated: skill in the aggregates, skill in the elements, skill in the spheres, skill in truth, skill in the vehicles, and skill in conditioned and unconditioned phenomena.

original: de la rtsa ba'i de kho na ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i de kho na ni ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The basic reality is the three natures:

original: kun brtags pa dang ; gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang ; gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: de la de kho na gzhan rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de kho na gzhan rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other realities are established on the basis of this one.

original: de ci'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid gsum la de kho na zhes bya bar 'dod ce na /üîΩngo bo nyid gsum rtag med dang // yod kyang kho na ma yin dang // yod dang med de kho na ste //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'dir ngo bo nyid gsum la de kho na zhes bya bar 'dod ce na / ngo bo nyid gsum rtag med dang // yod kyang kho na ma yin dang // yod dang med de kho na ste //
translated: Why are the three natures considered to be reality here?üîΩThe three natures are considered to be reality:

original: ngo bo nyid ni gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gsum du 'dod //
translated: the non-existent, the existent but not real, and the existent.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtag tu med pa'o //
translated: The imagined characteristic is always non-existent.

original: de ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la de kho na zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la de kho na zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called reality in the imagined nature,

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-erroneous.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang yang dag pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang yang dag pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other-dependent characteristic exists, but not in reality, because it is erroneous.

original: de lta bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the reality of the other-dependent nature is just that.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa dang med pa'i de kho na ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni yod pa dang med pa'i de kho na ste /
translated: The reality of the perfected characteristic is both existence and non-existence.

original: de bas na 'di ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la de kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid la de kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, this is the reality of the perfected nature.

original: mtshan nyid kyi de kho na gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de kho na gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of the characteristics?

original: 'di la chos dang gang zag dang // gzung ba dag dang 'dzin pa dang // yod dang med par sgro 'dogs pa dang // skur ba 'debs par lta ba dang // gang shes nas ni mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: 'di la chos dang gang zag dang // gzung ba dag dang 'dzin pa dang // yod dang med par sgro 'dogs pa dang // skur ba 'debs par lta ba dang // gang shes nas ni mi 'byung ba //
translated: Here, the views of imputation as existent and negation as non-existent Regarding the person and phenomena, the apprehended and apprehender, Are the over-estimation and underestimation of the person and phenomena.üîΩKnowing that, they do not arise.

original: de de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: That is the reality of the characteristics.

original: gang shes nas gang zag dang chos gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni kun @11a * //
analyzed: gang shes nas gang zag dang chos gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni kun @11a * //
translated: Knowing that, the views of over-estimation and underestimation regarding the person and phenomena do not arise.

original: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩgang shes nas gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do // gang shes nas gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gnyis la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of reality in terms of the imagined nature.üîΩThis is the characteristic of reality in terms of the dependent nature.

original: gang shes nas dngos po dang dngos po med par sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang shes nas dngos po dang dngos po med par sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs par lta ba mi 'byung ba de ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi de kho na'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of reality in terms of the perfected nature.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na la mtshan nyid kyi de kho na phyin ci ma log pa 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na la mtshan nyid kyi de kho na phyin ci ma log pa 'di ni mtshan nyid kyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the reality of characteristics.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na ni rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i de kho na ni rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: The reality of non-erroneous inversion is the antidote to erroneous inversion in terms of permanence, etc. It is impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na der ji ltar na mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na der ji ltar na mi rtag pa la sogs pa nyid rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand impermanence, etc. in the basic reality?üîΩImpermanence has the meaning of non-existence,üîΩthe characteristic of arising and passing away,

original: mi rtag don ni med don dang // skye zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang // dri bcas dri ma med don te //
analyzed: mi rtag don ni med don dang // skye zhing 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid dang // dri bcas dri ma med don te //
translated: and the meaning of being stained and stainless.

original: rtsa ba'i kho nar go rims bzhin //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i kho nar go rims bzhin //
translated: In the basic reality, they are in order.

original: mi rtag pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Impermanence has three meanings:

original: med pa'i don dang / skye zhing 'jig pa'i don dang / dri ma dang bcas shing dri ma med pa nyid kyi don ni rtsa ba'i de kho nar ngo bo nyid gsum po dag dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: med pa'i don dang / skye zhing 'jig pa'i don dang / dri ma dang bcas shing dri ma med pa nyid kyi don ni rtsa ba'i de kho nar ngo bo nyid gsum po dag dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: the meaning of non-existence, the meaning of arising and passing away, and the meaning of being stained and stainless. In the basic reality, they correspond to the three natures in order.üîΩSuffering is accepted as having the characteristic ofüîΩappropriation, the characteristic of the nature of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal len dang mtshan nyid dang // 'brel ba gzhan du 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal len dang mtshan nyid dang // 'brel ba gzhan du 'dod pa yin //
translated: and the characteristic of association with other suffering.

original: gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa nye bar len pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la mngon par zhen pa nye bar len pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the appropriation of attachment to persons and phenomena,üîΩand because of the characteristic of the nature of suffering,üîΩand because of the association with other suffering,üîΩsuffering is accepted as having the characteristic of appropriation, the characteristic of the nature of suffering, and the characteristic of association with other suffering.

original: nye bar len pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'brel ba yang ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid gsum gyi mtshan nyid yin pas mtshan nyid dang / sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa'i phyir 'brel ba yang ste /
translated: Since it is related to suffering, it is the relation.

original: rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid kyi nang du go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i de kho na nyid kyi nang du go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is the root reality, respectively.üîΩNon-entity is not an entity,

original: dngos med de dngos ma yin dang // rang bzhin gyis ni stong par 'dod //
analyzed: dngos med de dngos ma yin dang // rang bzhin gyis ni stong par 'dod //
translated: and is held to be empty by nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gang gis kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gang gis kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The imagined characteristic does not exist in any way at all.

original: dngos po med pa nyid pas de'i stong pa nyid do ;
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid pas de'i stong pa nyid do ;
translated: Since it is a non-entity, it is emptiness.

original: / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni ji ltar kun brtags pa de ltar med kyi /
analyzed: / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni ji ltar kun brtags pa de ltar med kyi /
translated: The relative characteristic does not exist as it is imagined,

original: ye shes med pa sa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ye shes med pa sa ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not non-existent in every way,

original: de ma yin pas de'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ma yin pas de'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: since it is not non-existent.

original: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The perfected characteristic

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kho na yin pas rang bzhin kho nas de'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kho na yin pas rang bzhin kho nas de'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: is just the nature of emptiness, so it is empty just by its nature.

original: mtshan @11b nyid med pas bdag med dang // de dang mi mthun mtshan nyid dang // rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan @11b nyid med pas bdag med dang // de dang mi mthun mtshan nyid dang // rang gi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin //
translated: The realitylessness of the imagined, the realitylessness of the dependent, and the realitylessness of the perfected are taught as the selflessness of identity, the selflessness of difference, and the selflessness of ultimate reality.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The realitylessness of the imagined is due to its non-existence by intrinsic identity.

original: mtshan nyid de'i bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de'i bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: That is the selflessness of identity.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang ji ltar kun tu brtags pa bzhin du med pas de dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de'i bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ni yod kyang ji ltar kun tu brtags pa bzhin du med pas de dang mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis de'i bdag med pa'o //
translated: The realitylessness of the dependent is due to the fact that, although it exists, it does not exist as it is imagined. That is the selflessness of difference.

original: yongs su grub pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis bdag med pa nyid pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyis de'i bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis bdag med pa nyid pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyis de'i bdag med pa'o //
translated: The realitylessness of the perfected is due to its very nature of selflessness. That is the selflessness of ultimate reality.üîΩThus, the three kinds of realitylessness are taught as the three kinds of selflessness.

original: rtsa ba de kho na rnam pa gsum la mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan to /
analyzed: rtsa ba de kho na rnam pa gsum la mi rtag pa nyid rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan to /
translated: The three kinds of impermanence are taught as the three kinds of realitylessness.

original: med pa'i don mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye zhing 'jig pa mi rtag pa nyid dang / dri ma dang bcas shing dri ma med pa mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa'i don mi rtag pa nyid dang / skye zhing 'jig pa mi rtag pa nyid dang / dri ma dang bcas shing dri ma med pa mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The three kinds of impermanence are the impermanence of non-existence, the impermanence of production and destruction, and the impermanence of defilement and purification.

original: sdug bsngal nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of suffering:

original: 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dad pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: aspiration, effort, faith, and pliancy.

original: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: They should be understood in order as follows:

original: gnas dang de la gnas pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnas dang de la gnas pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du'o //
translated: the basis, that which is based on it, the cause, and the result.

original: rtsol ba'i gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: rtsol ba'i gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is the basis of effort.

original: gnas pa ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: Effort is based on it.

original: gnas 'dun pa de'i rgyu ni dad pa ste /
analyzed: gnas 'dun pa de'i rgyu ni dad pa ste /
translated: Faith is the cause of that basis, aspiration,

original: yid ches par gyur na mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ches par gyur na mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one has confidence, one aspires.

original: gnas rtsol ba de'i 'bras bu ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: gnas rtsol ba de'i 'bras bu ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: The result of the effort of abiding is fitness.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains the distinctive meditative concentration through the practice of effort.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed lhag ma bzhi ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms te nyes pa bzhi'i gnyen por grangs bzhin no //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed lhag ma bzhi ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang / btang snyoms te nyes pa bzhi'i gnyen por grangs bzhin no //
translated: The remaining four applications of abandoning are mindfulness, vigilance, volition, and equanimity. They are the antidotes to the four faults, respectively.

original: de dag kyang dran pa la sogs par rig par bya ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang dran pa la sogs par rig par bya ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: They should be understood as mindfulness and so on, respectively.üîΩNot forgetting the object of meditation,üîΩrealizing laxity and excitation,üîΩapplying the antidotes to them,

original: dmigs pa brjed par ma gyur dang // bying dang rgod pa rtogs pa dang // de spong mngon par 'du byed dang // zhi tshe rnal du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa brjed par ma gyur dang // bying dang rgod pa rtogs pa dang // de spong mngon par 'du byed dang // zhi tshe rnal du 'jug pa'o //
translated: and when tranquil, remaining in equipoise.

original: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni dmigs pa ma brjed pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is not forgetting the object of meditation.

original: shes bzhin ni dran pa ma brjed par gyur na bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin ni dran pa ma brjed par gyur na bying ba dang rgod pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: Vigilance is realizing laxity and excitation when mindfulness does not forget.

original: rtogs nas de dang 'bral ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs nas de dang 'bral ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: Volition is applying the antidotes to them in order to be free of them.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa de nye bar zhi bar gyur pa na rnal du 'jug pa ni sems btang snyoms su byed pa'o //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa de nye bar zhi bar gyur pa na rnal du 'jug pa ni sems btang snyoms su byed pa'o //
translated: When slackness and excitedness are calmed, the mind is in its natural condition, and this is the equanimity of the mind.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'og tu dbang po rnams te dad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa'i 'og tu dbang po rnams te dad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The faculties are faith, etc.

original: de dag las ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de dag las ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are they established?

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun bskyed nas //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun bskyed nas //
translated: Having generated the aids to liberation,üîΩthe faculties are the predominance of aspiration,

original: 'dun dang sbyor ba dbang byed dang // dmigs pa brjed par ma gyur dang // mi 'phro rnam par 'byed kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dun dang sbyor ba dbang byed dang // dmigs pa brjed par ma gyur dang // mi 'phro rnam par 'byed kyang ngo //
translated: application, mastery, non-forgetting of the object,

original: dbang byed pa zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: dbang byed pa zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: non-diffusion, and thorough analysis.üîΩThe faculties are the predominance of aspiration, application, mastery, non-forgetting of the object, non-diffusion, and thorough analysis.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi sems las su rung ba dang / thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyi sems las su rung ba dang / thar ba'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated the flexibility of mind through the bases of supernatural powers and the roots of virtue that are aids to liberation,

original: 'dun pa ni dbang byed pa /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni dbang byed pa /
translated: aspiration is the predominance of aspiration.

original: sbyor ba ni dbang byed pa /üîΩdmigs pa na brjed pa ni dbang byed pa /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni dbang byed pa / dmigs pa na brjed pa ni dbang byed pa /
translated: Application is the predominance of application.üîΩNon-forgetting of the object is the predominance of mastery.

original: mi 'phro ba ni dbang byed pa //
analyzed: mi 'phro ba ni dbang byed pa //
translated: Non-diffusion is the predominance of non-forgetting of the object.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ni dbang byed pa ste /
translated: Thorough analysis is the predominance of non-diffusion.

original: @17a * // dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga dag dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @17a * // dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga dag dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The five faculties of faith, etc., should be understood in the same order as the five powers.üîΩThe five powers are the same as the five faculties, but they are called ‚Äúpowers‚Äù when they become overwhelming.

original: dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba la stobs rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba la stobs rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: The five powers are called ‚Äúpowers‚Äù because they overwhelm the resistances,

original: de dag mi mthun phyogs ni srab pa'i phyir /üîΩstobs ldan gang gi tshe de dag nyid ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi 'dre ba na'o //
analyzed: de dag mi mthun phyogs ni srab pa'i phyir / stobs ldan gang gi tshe de dag nyid ma dad pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi 'dre ba na'o //
translated: because they are not overwhelmed by their resistances.

original: ci'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa snga phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dad pa la sogs pa snga phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are faith, etc., taught in this order?

original: 'di ltar snga ma'i 'bras bu phyi ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar snga ma'i 'bras bu phyi ma yin /
translated: Because the latter arises from the former.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la dad par gyur ba'i rgyus 'bras bu la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la dad par gyur ba'i rgyus 'bras bu la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: One who has faith in the result strives for it.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas ni dran pa nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas ni dran pa nye bar gnas so //
translated: One who strives becomes mindful.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas pas ni sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas pas ni sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: One who is mindful stabilizes his mind.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pas ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: One who stabilizes his mind understands reality as it is.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed zin nas dbang po rnams bstan na /üîΩnges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ci dbang po'i dus la rig par bya'am /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed zin nas dbang po rnams bstan na / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ci dbang po'i dus la rig par bya'am /
translated: When the faculties are taught after the factors conducive to penetrations have been generated,

original: 'on te stobs kyi dus la rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te stobs kyi dus la rig par bya zhe na /
translated: should the factors conducive to penetrations be known in terms of the time of the faculties or in terms of the time of the powers?

original: dbang po rnams dang stobs rnams la //
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang stobs rnams la //
translated: The faculties and powers

original: des 'byed cha mthun gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: des 'byed cha mthun gnyis gnyis so //
translated: are two pairs that distinguish them.

original: dro bar gyur pa rnams dang rtse mo dag gi tshe ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa rnams dang rtse mo dag gi tshe ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The faculties are at the time of heat and summits.

original: bzod pa dag dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi tshe ni stobs rnams so //
analyzed: bzod pa dag dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyi tshe ni stobs rnams so //
translated: The powers are at the time of the acceptance and supreme mundane qualities.

original: stobs kyi 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: stobs kyi 'og tu byang chub kyi yan lag rnams te /
translated: After the powers come the branches of enlightenment.

original: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are they posited?

original: rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag / gsum pa nges 'byung yan lag ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin yan lag gnas yan lag / gsum pa nges 'byung yan lag ste //
translated: The nature branch, the branch of abiding, the third is the branch of renunciation,

original: bzhi pa phan yon yan lag yin //
analyzed: bzhi pa phan yon yan lag yin //
translated: the fourth is the branch of benefit.

original: rnam gsum nyon mongs med yan lag / mthong ba'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: rnam gsum nyon mongs med yan lag / mthong ba'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag tu gyur pa dag ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: The limbs of enlightenment are the factors that are the limbs of enlightenment on the path of seeing.

original: de la dran pa ni byang chub kyi gnas kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: de la dran pa ni byang chub kyi gnas kyi yan lag go //
translated: Among them, mindfulness is the limb of enlightenment that is the basis of enlightenment.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni rang bzhin gyi yan lag go //
translated: The investigation of phenomena is the limb of enlightenment that is the nature of enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag go //
translated: Exertion is the limb of enlightenment that is the origin of enlightenment.

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //üîΩrnam pa gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag go // rnam pa gsum ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Joy is the limb of enlightenment that is the benefit of enlightenment.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: The three, pliancy, concentration, and equanimity, are the limbs of enlightenment that are the absence of defilement.

original: ci'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag rnam pa gsum du bstan zhe na /üîΩ'di la gzhi dang gnas dang ni //
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag rnam pa gsum du bstan zhe na / 'di la gzhi dang gnas dang ni //
translated: Why are the limbs of enlightenment taught as three that are the absence of defilement?üîΩThey are taught as the basis,

original: @17b ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin //
analyzed: @17b ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin //
translated: the abode, and the nature.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni gnas ngan len gyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Defilement arises from the cause of negative tendencies.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: Pliancy is the basis of the absence of defilement,

original: de ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the counteragent to the latter.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni gnas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni gnas so //
translated: Concentration is the support.

original: btang snyoms ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Equanimity is the nature.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'og tu lam gyi yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag gi 'og tu lam gyi yan lag rnams te /
translated: The limbs of the path are mentioned immediately following the limbs of enlightenment.

original: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /üîΩyongs su gcod dang go byed dang // rnam gsum gzhan yid ches par byed //üîΩmi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen por ni //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na / yongs su gcod dang go byed dang // rnam gsum gzhan yid ches par byed // mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen por ni //
translated: How are they respectively determined?

original: lam gyi yan lag de brgyad do //
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag de brgyad do //
translated: The limbs of the path are eight:üîΩcorrect view, correct intention, correct speech, correct action, correct livelihood, correct effort, correct mindfulness and correct concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi tshe mthong ba'i lam la yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi tshe mthong ba'i lam la yongs su gcod pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Correct view is the limb of discernment on the path of meditative development,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa des rang gi rtogs pa yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa 'jig rten pa des rang gi rtogs pa yongs su gcod do //
translated: because the supramundane, or the mundane path that is attained subsequently to the supramundane, discerns one's own understanding.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag ni gzhan go bar byed pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: Correct intention and correct speech are the limbs that cause others to understand.

original: kun slong ba dang bcas pas ngag gi de go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun slong ba dang bcas pas ngag gi de go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cause the understanding of speech.

original: gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yid ches par byed pa'i yan lag ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The limbs of conviction in others are three:

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba'o //
translated: right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du /
translated: They are, respectively,

original: lta dang tshul khrims yo byad bsnyungs //
analyzed: lta dang tshul khrims yo byad bsnyungs //
translated: view, morality, and few desires.

original: gzhan la rnam par rig byed 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan la rnam par rig byed 'dod //
translated: Others are convinced by the communication of knowledge.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag gis bsnyad pa dang / 'brel pa'i gtam rnam par nges pas shes rab la yid ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag gis bsnyad pa dang / 'brel pa'i gtam rnam par nges pas shes rab la yid ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: Others are convinced of wisdom through the communication of knowledge and the ascertainment of connected speech through right speech.

original: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni tshul khrims la ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' ni tshul khrims la ste /
translated: Others are convinced of morality through right action,

original: bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not do what should not be done.

original: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni yo byad bsnyungs pa la ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho bas ni yo byad bsnyungs pa la ste /
translated: Others are convinced of fewness of desires through right livelihood,

original: chos kyis gas la sogs pa tshod zin par tshol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyis gas la sogs pa tshod zin par tshol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one seeks robes and so on in moderation and in accordance with the Dharma.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i yan lag ni rnam par gsum ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i yan lag ni rnam par gsum ste /
translated: The limbs of the antidote to the resistances are three:

original: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //üîΩde dag ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to // de dag ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.üîΩThey are antidotes to the three kinds of obstacles.

original: nyon mongs nye ba'i nyon mongs dbang //
analyzed: nyon mongs nye ba'i nyon mongs dbang //
translated: The three kinds of obstacles are:üîΩthe passions and secondary passions,

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: and the obstacles to the counteractions.

original: mi mthun phyogs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The obstacles are of three kinds:

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang / rgod pa'i dbang gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs te /üîΩyon tan @18a * //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba dang / rgod pa'i dbang gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs te / yon tan @18a * //
translated: the passions and secondary passions which are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, and the obstacles to the counteractions, which are caused by slackness and excitedness.

original: khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i gegs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i gegs su gyur pa'o //
translated: They are obstacles to the attainment of special qualities.

original: de la dang po'i gnyen po ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: de la dang po'i gnyen po ni yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ste /
translated: The antidote to the first is right effort,

original: des lam bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des lam bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cultivates the path.

original: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yang dag pa'i dran pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the second is right mindfulness,

original: zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar gnas pas bying ba dang rgod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams la dran pa shin tu nye bar gnas pas bying ba dang rgod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is not slack or excited when mindfulness is well established in the causes of calm etc.

original: gsum pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: gsum pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The antidote to the third is right concentration,üîΩbecause it is the basis of the supermundane qualities.

original: bsam gtan la gnas nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan la gnas nas mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having abided in meditative concentration, one accomplishes the superknowledges and other qualities.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa de mdor bsu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa de mdor bsu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of counteragents should be understood in brief as threefold:

original: rjes su mthun la phyin ci log //üîΩrjes su 'brel bcas bzlog pa dang // phyin ci ma log phyin ci log / rjes su 'brel med bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun la phyin ci log // rjes su 'brel bcas bzlog pa dang // phyin ci ma log phyin ci log / rjes su 'brel med bsgom pa'o //
translated: 1. in conformity with the absence of impurity, but erroneous;üîΩ2. in conformity with the absence of impurity, and nonerroneous, but associated with effort;

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su mthun la phyin ci log pa dang / phyin ci log med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel pa dang / phyin ci log kyang med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba yang med pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i rjes su mthun la phyin ci log pa dang / phyin ci log med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel pa dang / phyin ci log kyang med la phyin ci log rjes su 'brel ba yang med pa ste /
translated: 3. in conformity with the absence of impurity, nonerroneous, and free of association with effort.

original: so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: The first is that of the ordinary person, the second that of the learner, and the third that of the post-learner.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni //
translated: The bodhisattvas‚Äô

original: dmigs dang yid la byed pa dang // thob pas de ni khyad par 'phags te /
analyzed: dmigs dang yid la byed pa dang // thob pas de ni khyad par 'phags te /
translated: is distinguished by its objective, mental activity, and attainment.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i lus la sogs pa la dmigs so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i lus la sogs pa la dmigs so //
translated: The disciples and hermit buddhas focus on the body, etc. , that is included in their own mental continuum.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: The bodhisattvas focus on those included in their own and others‚Äô mental continua.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ni lus la sogs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par yid la byed do //

analyzed: de la sgrub pa bla na med pa nyid ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu bsgrub par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa de dag la'o //

analyzed: dam pa dang ni yid byed dang // rjes mthun chos mtha' spangs pa dang // khyad par can dang khyad par med //
translated: 1. The highest, 2. attention, 3. the Dharma which is in conformity, 4. the avoidance of the two extremes, 5. the special, and 6. the non-special.

original: rnam pa drug po 'di dag ni sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa drug po 'di dag ni sgrub pa ste /

translated: Thus, the practice of the highest, the practice of attention, the practice of the Dharma which is in conformity, the practice of the avoidance of the two extremes, the practice of the special, and the practice of the non-special.üîΩTherein,

analyzed: de la / dam pa bcu gnyis bdag nyid de //
translated: The highest is considered to be of twelve kinds:üîΩExtensive, long-lasting, having a purpose, inexhaustible, uninterrupted, effortless,üîΩmasterful, comprehensive,

analyzed: rgya che ba dang yun ring dang // ched du bya ba dang mi zad dang // rgyun mi 'chad dang tshegs med dang ; / dbang 'byor ba dang yongs gzung dang // rtsom dang thob dang rgyu mthun dang // 'grub pa dam par 'dod pa yin //
translated: beginning, attainment, causal, and resultant.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis lo 'di dag ni dam pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis lo 'di dag ni dam pa ste /
translated: These are the twelve kinds of highest.

original: 'di ltar rgya che ba dam pa dang / yun ring ba dam pa dang / ched du bya ba dam pa dang / zad mi shes pa dam pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa dang / tshegs med pa dam pa dang / dbang 'byor ba dam pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgya che ba dam pa dang / yun ring ba dam pa dang / ched du bya ba dam pa dang / zad mi shes pa dam pa dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa dang / tshegs med pa dam pa dang / dbang 'byor ba dam pa dang /
translated: Thus, the supremacy of the universal vehicle is to be known as supreme in seven ways: in its universality, in its loftiness, in its duration, in its purpose, in its inexhaustibility, in its continuity, in its ease, in its mastery,

original: yongs su gzung ba dam pa dang / rtsom pa dam pa dang / rab tu thob pa dam pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dam pa dang / 'grub pa dam pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba dam pa dang / rtsom pa dam pa dang / rab tu thob pa dam pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dam pa dang / 'grub pa dam pa'o //
translated: in its possession, in its undertaking, in its attainment, in its natural outcome, and in its accomplishment.

original: de la rgya che ba dam pa ni /
analyzed: de la rgya che ba dam pa ni /
translated: The supremacy of the universal vehicle is to be known as supreme in seven ways: in its universality, in its loftiness, in its duration, in its purpose, in its inexhaustibility, in its continuity, in its ease, in its mastery,üîΩin its possession, in its undertaking, in its attainment, in its natural outcome, and in its accomplishment.

original: 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang mchog tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang mchog tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The supremacy of universality is to be known as supreme in its non-desire for all mundane perfections and in its knowledge of the highest.

original: yun ring pa dam pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring pa dam pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro //

original: zad mi shes pa dam pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos @20b pas gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa dam pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos @20b pas gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest of the inexhaustible is the dedication to great enlightenment, because it is never exhausted.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dam pa ni bdag gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dam pa ni bdag gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir te /
translated: The highest of the uninterrupted is the dedication to the equality of self and others,

original: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one perfects the transcendences such as generosity by means of generosity, etc.

original: tshegs med pa dam pa ni gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshegs med pa dam pa ni gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest of the effortless is the dedication by rejoicing in the generosity, etc. of others, because one perfects the transcendences by merely rejoicing.

original: dbang 'byor pa dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest of the mastery is the dedication by means of the concentration of the skytreasury, etc., because one perfects the transcendences such as generosity by means of the concentration of the skytreasury, etc.

original: yongs su gzung ba dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest of the protection is the dedication by means of nonconceptual intuition, because it is protected by the transcendences.

original: rtsom pa dam pa ni mos pa sa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa cher gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa dam pa ni mos pa sa spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa cher gyur pa'o //
translated: The highest composition is on the stage of action through faith, when patience is greatly increased.

original: 'thob pa dam pa ni sa dang po la'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa dam pa ni sa dang po la'o //
translated: The highest attainment is on the first stage.

original: rgyu mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan brgyad po dag la'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa gzhan brgyad po dag la'o //
translated: The highest natural outcome is on the other eight stages.

original: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang / sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang / sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest accomplishment is on the tenth stage and on the stage of the tathiigatatas, because the bodhisattva is accomplished and the buddha is accomplished.

original: de'i phyir dam pa'i don gyis ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa'i don gyis ni //
translated: Therefore,

original: pha rol gyin pa bcur 'dod do //
analyzed: pha rol gyin pa bcur 'dod do //
translated: the perfections are accepted as ten in number.

original: 'di ltar dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni de dag la yod pa'i phyir dam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dag ni de dag la yod pa'i phyir dam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because these twelve kinds of highest are found in them, they are called perfections.

original: don 'dis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag tu 'dod do //
analyzed: don 'dis pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dag tu 'dod do //
translated: By this meaning, the perfections are accepted as ten in number.üîΩIn order to show their names to those who wonder what the ten are,

original: kha cig bcu gang yin snyam du sems pa la de dag gi ming bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig bcu gang yin snyam du sems pa la de dag gi ming bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: he says,üîΩGenerosity, morality, patience,

original: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
analyzed: sbyin dang tshul khrims bzod brtson 'grus //
translated: exertion,üîΩmeditation,üîΩwisdom,

original: bsam gtan dang ni shes rab thabs //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ni shes rab thabs //
translated: means,

original: slon lam stobs dang ye shes dang // 'di dag pha rol phyin pa bcu //
analyzed: slon lam stobs dang ye shes dang // 'di dag pha rol phyin pa bcu //
translated: The ten perfections are the perfections of giving, morality, patience, exertion, meditation, wisdom, means, resolve, strength, and direct intuition.

original: zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: This is stated.

original: 'di dag gis so so'i las ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gis so so'i las ci zhe na /
translated: What is the individual function of these?

original: las ni rjes su 'dzin byed dang // gnod mi byed dang de la bzod //
analyzed: las ni rjes su 'dzin byed dang // gnod mi byed dang de la bzod //
translated: The function is to care for, not to harm, to forbear harm,üîΩto increase virtue, to be able to introduce, to liberate,

original: yon tan 'phel dang 'dzud nus dang // rnam par grol bar bya ba dang // mi zad pa dang rtag 'jug dang // nges par longs spyod smin par byed //
analyzed: yon tan 'phel dang 'dzud nus dang // rnam par grol bar bya ba dang // mi zad pa dang rtag 'jug dang // nges par longs spyod smin par byed //
translated: to be inexhaustible, to engage constantly, and to bring about the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du de dag gi las te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du de dag gi las te /
translated: These are their functions in order.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pas ni sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pas ni sems can rnams rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: By giving, the bodhisattva cares for sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni de dag la gnod par mi byed do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni de dag la gnod par mi byed do //

original: bzod pas ni gzhan dag gis gnod par byas pa la ci mi snyam par byed do //
analyzed: bzod pas ni gzhan dag gis gnod par byas pa la ci mi snyam par byed do //
translated: By patience, he forbears harm done by others.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni yon tan rnams 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni yon tan rnams 'phel bar byed do //
translated: By exertion, he increases his virtues.

original: bsam gtan @21a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan @21a * //
translated: By meditation,üîΩhe introduces them by pleasing them with his psychic power, etc.

original: gyis ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas mgu bar byas te 'dzud do //
analyzed: gyis ni rdzu 'phrul la sogs pas mgu bar byas te 'dzud do //
translated: By wisdom, he liberates them.üîΩBy the perfection of means, he does not abandon samsara.üîΩBy the perfection of resolve, he is reborn in samsara and is not affected by its faults.üîΩBy the perfection of strength, he is inexhaustible in his efforts to help and to harm.üîΩBy the perfection of direct intuition, he engages constantly in the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: shes rab kyis ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag byin pas rnam par grol bar byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag byin pas rnam par grol bar byed do //
translated: And by means of wisdom, one liberates them by giving the right instructions.

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pas sbyin pa la sogs pa mi zad par byed do //
translated: By means of the perfection of skillful means, one makes one's generosity, etc. inexhaustible by dedicating it to great enlightenment.

original: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pas tshe rabs thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung ba la mnyes par byed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa la rtag tu 'jug go //
analyzed: smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni mthun pa'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin pas tshe rabs thams cad du sangs rgyas 'byung ba la mnyes par byed cing sbyin pa la sogs pa la rtag tu 'jug go //
translated: By means of the perfection of vows, one takes up favorable rebirths and in all one's lives one serves the Buddhas and always engages in generosity, etc.

original: stobs kyi pha rol tu phin pas ni so sor rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs gnyis kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa la nges par 'jug go //
analyzed: stobs kyi pha rol tu phin pas ni so sor rtog pa dang / bsgom pa'i stobs gnyis kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa la nges par 'jug go //
translated: By means of the perfection of the powers, one definitely engages in generosity, etc. because one's antidotes are not overwhelmed by their resistant tendencies, due to the power of both analysis and cultivation.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni chos la sgra ji bzhin du rmongs pa dang bral bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i chos la longs spyod pa myong ba dang / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ni chos la sgra ji bzhin du rmongs pa dang bral bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i chos la longs spyod pa myong ba dang / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: By the perfection of wisdom, one is free from confusion about the Dharma as it is taught, and so one experiences the enjoyment of the Dharma that is taught in the context of generosity, etc. and one brings beings to full maturity.

original: dam pa bsgrub pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dam pa bsgrub pa bshad zin to //
translated: The accomplishment of the highest has been explained.

original: yid la byed pa bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bsgrub pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: theg pa chen por ci lta bur // chos rnams btags par mdzad pa dang // byang chub sems dpa' rtag par yang //
translated: In the Mahayana,üîΩthe bodhisattva always mentally attends

original: shes rab gsum gyis yid byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab gsum gyis yid byed pa'o //
translated: to the Dharma as it is taught by the three wisdoms.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas theg pa chen por mdo la sogs pa ji ltar btags pa'i chos rnams thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis rgyun du yid la byed pa ni yid la byed pa bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dbang du mdzad nas theg pa chen por mdo la sogs pa ji ltar btags pa'i chos rnams thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis rgyun du yid la byed pa ni yid la byed pa bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of mental attention is the constant mental attention to the Dharma as it is taught in the Mahayana, in the context of generosity, etc., by means of the wisdom that arises from listening, reflection, and meditative development.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis yid la byed pa des yon tan ci zhig thob ce na /
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis yid la byed pa des yon tan ci zhig thob ce na /
translated: What qualities are obtained by the three kinds of wisdom that are mental attentions?

original: khams brtas byed dang 'jug byed dang // de ni don rnams 'grub par 'gyur //üîΩthos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis yid la byed pas khams brtas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khams brtas byed dang 'jug byed dang // de ni don rnams 'grub par 'gyur // thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis yid la byed pas khams brtas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The element is nourished, one enters, and one accomplishes the aims.üîΩThe element is nourished by mental attention that is wisdom born of listening.

original: bsams pa las byung bas ni thos pa de'i don la snying nas 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung bas ni thos pa de'i don la snying nas 'jug par byed do //
translated: One enters the meaning of what one has heard from the depths of one's heart by means of wisdom born of reflection.

original: bsgoms pa las byung bas ni don 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung bas ni don 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: One accomplishes the aims by means of wisdom born of meditative development.

original: sa la 'jug pa yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa la 'jug pa yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //

original: yid la byed pa sgrub pa ste //
analyzed: yid la byed pa sgrub pa ste //

original: de yang chos spyod pa rnam pa bcus yongs su gzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chos spyod pa rnam pa bcus yongs su gzung bar rig par bya'o //

original: chos spyod rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos spyod rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /

analyzed: yi ge 'dri mchod sbyin pa dang // nyan dang klog dang len pa @21b dang // 'chad dang kha ton byed pa dang // de sems pa dang sgom pa'o //
translated: reflecting, and meditating.

original: theg pa chen po'i ye ge 'dri ba dang / mchod pa dang / gzhan dgal sbyin pa dang / gzhan klog pa la nyan pa dang / bdag nyid klog pa dang / len pa dang / tshig dang don 'chad pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i ye ge 'dri ba dang / mchod pa dang / gzhan dgal sbyin pa dang / gzhan klog pa la nyan pa dang / bdag nyid klog pa dang / len pa dang / tshig dang don 'chad pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang /
translated: Writing the letters of the Great Vehicle, worship of the Great Vehicle, giving the Great Vehicle to others, listening to the reading of others, reading it oneself, taking it up, explaining its words and meanings, reciting it,

original: sems pa dang sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa dang sgom pa'o //
translated: reflecting on it, and meditating on it.

original: spyod pa de bcu'i bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: spyod pa de bcu'i bdag nyid ni //
translated: These ten activities

original: bsod nams phung po dpag tu med //
analyzed: bsod nams phung po dpag tu med //
translated: are the immeasurable heap of merit.

analyzed: ci'i phyir mdo dag las theg pa chen po nyid kyi chos spyod pa ni shin tu 'bras bu che bar bstan gyi /

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa la ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa la ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: and not the practice of the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas?

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: It is because of two reasons:

original: khyad par phyir dang mi zad phyir //
analyzed: khyad par phyir dang mi zad phyir //
translated: because of its superiority and because of its inexhaustibility.

original: khyad par phyir ni ci lta bu //
analyzed: khyad par phyir ni ci lta bu //

original: mi zad pa'i phyir ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi zad pa'i phyir ci lta bu zhe na /

translated: It is superior because it is engaged in helping others.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na yang zhi ba med cing rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir mi zad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na yang zhi ba med cing rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir mi zad par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as inexhaustible because it is never exhausted even in Nirvana, and because it is uninterrupted.

original: yid la byed pa bsgrub pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: yid la byed pa bsgrub pa bshad zin to //
translated: The accomplishment of mental attention has been explained.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa gang zhe na /üîΩmi g-yeng phyin ci ma log par //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa gang zhe na / mi g-yeng phyin ci ma log par //
translated: What is the accomplishment of favorable things?

original: gyur pa rjes su mthun pa'i chos //
analyzed: gyur pa rjes su mthun pa'i chos //
translated: Favorable things are the absence of distraction and the absence of error.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa ste /
translated: These two aspects are the accomplishment of favorable things.

original: 'di ltar rnam par mi g-yeng ba dang phyin ci ma log par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par mi g-yeng ba dang phyin ci ma log par gyur pa'o //
translated: They are the absence of distraction and the absence of error.

original: de la rnam par mi g-yeng ba rnam pa drug med pa'i phyir mi g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi g-yeng ba rnam pa drug med pa'i phyir mi g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The absence of distraction is due to the absence of the six kinds of distraction.

original: g-yeng ba rnam pa drug ni /
analyzed: g-yeng ba rnam pa drug ni /
translated: The six kinds of distraction are:

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol tu rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par g-yeng ba dang / phyi rol tu rnam par g-yeng ba dang / nang gi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba dang / yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Natural distraction, external distraction, internal distraction, distraction concerning characteristics, distraction of addiction, and distraction of mental orientation.

original: 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci lta bur rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci lta bur rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What are their characteristics?üîΩArising, engagement with objects,

original: ldang dang yul la 'jug pa dang // de bzhin ro myang bying dang rgod //
analyzed: ldang dang yul la 'jug pa dang // de bzhin ro myang bying dang rgod //
translated: and likewise, savoring, sinking, and agitation,üîΩConfidence, mental orientation,

original: yid ches pa yi bsam pa dang // yid la byed pa ngar 'dzin dang // chung ngu'i sems ni g-yeng ba ste //
analyzed: yid ches pa yi bsam pa dang // yid la byed pa ngar 'dzin dang // chung ngu'i sems ni g-yeng ba ste //
translated: self-satisfaction, and a small amount of mind are distractions.

original: blo ldan rnams kyis shes par bya //
analyzed: blo ldan rnams kyis shes par bya //
translated: The wise should know them.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa drug gi mtshan nyid ni de lta bu yin te /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba rnam pa drug gi mtshan nyid ni de lta bu yin te /
translated: These are the characteristics of the six kinds of distraction.

original: de byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should understand them.

original: de la ldang ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba ste /
analyzed: de la ldang ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams kyis ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba ste /
translated: The five groups of consciousnesses are distracted from concentration.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: This is natural distraction.

original: yul la 'jug pa ni phyi rol tu rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: yul la 'jug pa ni phyi rol tu rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The distraction of objects is external distraction.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa ni nang gi @22a * //üîΩrnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba dang / bying ba dang / rgod pa ni nang gi @22a * // rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The distraction of meditative concentration is internal distraction.

original: yid ches pa'i bsam pa ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i bsam pa ni mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
translated: The distraction of signs is the intention of confidence.

original: de mtshan mar byas nas sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mtshan mar byas nas sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one applies oneself by making signs.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa na gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa na gnas ngan len gyi rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
translated: The distraction of mental activity associated with the conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù is the distraction of negative influence.

original: gnas ngan len gyi dbang gis nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi dbang gis nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conceit ‚ÄúI am‚Äù occurs due to the influence of negative influence.

original: dman pa'i sems ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: dman pa'i sems ni yid la byed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
translated: The distraction of mental activity of the inferior attitude is the distraction of inferior attitude.

original: theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa yid la byed pa kun tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mental activity of the inferior vehicle occurs.

original: de la phyin ci ma log pa'i dngos po ni rnam pa bcus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la phyin ci ma log pa'i dngos po ni rnam pa bcus rig par bya ste /
translated: The unerring entity should be known through ten aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten?üîΩThe unerring entity is to be known through ten aspects:

original: yi ge don dang yid byed dang // mi 'phro ba dang mtshan nyid gnyis //
analyzed: yi ge don dang yid byed dang // mi 'phro ba dang mtshan nyid gnyis //
translated: 1) syllables, 2) meaning, 3) mental attention, 4) non-dispersal, 5) two realities,

original: ma dag dag dang glo bur dang // mi sdang ba dang khengs pa med //
analyzed: ma dag dag dang glo bur dang // mi sdang ba dang khengs pa med //
translated: 6) impure, 7) pure, 8) adventitious, 9) non-aversion, 10) non-arrogance.üîΩTherein,üîΩbecause of connection, because of familiarity,

original: de la / 'brel ba'i phyir dang 'dris phyir dang // ma 'brel phyir dang ma 'dris phyir //
analyzed: de la / 'brel ba'i phyir dang 'dris phyir dang // ma 'brel phyir dang ma 'dris phyir //
translated: because of non-connection, because of non-familiarity,

original: don yod pa dang med pa ste //
analyzed: don yod pa dang med pa ste //
translated: the meaning is existent and non-existent.

original: de ni yi ge ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de ni yi ge ma log pa'o //
translated: That is the unerring syllable.

original: yi ge rnams dang 'brel te rgyun mi 'chad par brjod pa dang / 'di'i ming ni 'di zhes bya'o zhes 'dris pas don yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yi ge rnams dang 'brel te rgyun mi 'chad par brjod pa dang / 'di'i ming ni 'di zhes bya'o zhes 'dris pas don yod pa nyid do //
