translated: The meaning is existent because of connection with the syllables, because of uninterrupted expression, and because of familiarity, thinking This is the name of that.üîΩThe opposite is non-existent.

original: bzlog pa ni don med pa nyid do zhes de ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni yi ge la phyin ci ma log par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni don med pa nyid do zhes de ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni yi ge la phyin ci ma log par rig par bya'o //
translated: That is the unerring syllable.

original: don la phyin ci ma log pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: don la phyin ci ma log pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the unerring meaning?

original: gnyis su snang bar gyur pa ni //
analyzed: gnyis su snang bar gyur pa ni //
translated: The appearance as duality

original: de ltar yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa ma yin te //
translated: It does not exist in that way.

original: de ni don la ma log par //
analyzed: de ni don la ma log par //
translated: That is the non-erroneous perception of the object,

original: yod dang med pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: yod dang med pa rnam par spangs //
translated: Abandoning both existence and non-existence.

original: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ste de'i rnam phar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ste de'i rnam phar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The two are the appearances of object and subject, because they arise in the aspect of those.

original: ji ltar snang ba de ltar ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de ltar ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not exist in the way it appears.

original: de ltar don la mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar don la mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: That is the non-erroneous perception of the object,

original: don gyi yod pa spangs pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi yod pa spangs pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandoning the existence of the object, because object and subject do not exist.

original: med pa spangs pa ni der snang ba'i 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrtog pa de yis bsgos pa yi //
analyzed: med pa spangs pa ni der snang ba'i 'khrul pa yod pa'i phyir ro // rtog pa de yis bsgos pa yi //
translated: Abandoning non-existence, because the error of appearing as those exists.üîΩThat is the conceptualization of object and subject.

original: rtog pa yid byed de'i gnas ni //
analyzed: rtog pa yid byed de'i gnas ni //
translated: The basis of that conceptualized attention

original: yid la byed pa ma log pa //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ma log pa //
translated: Is the non-abandonment of attention

original: gnyis su snang ba'i rgyu la'o //üîΩgzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pas yongs su bsgos pa ni rtog pa'i yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su snang ba'i rgyu la'o // gzung ba dang 'dzin par rtog pas yongs su bsgos pa ni rtog pa'i yid la byed pa ste /
translated: To the cause of the appearance of duality.üîΩThe conceptualized attention is the complete impregnation of the conceptualization of object and subject.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa de'i rten yin pas /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa de'i rten yin pas /
translated: It is the basis of the conceptualization of object and subject.

original: 'di ni yid la byed pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid la byed pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: This is the non-erroneous mental attention.

original: yid la byed pa gang la phyin ci ma log ce na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gang la phyin ci ma log ce na /
translated: With regard to what mental attention is non-erroneous,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su snang ba'i rgyu la ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis su snang ba'i rgyu la ste /
translated: it is with regard to the cause of the appearance of the duality of the grasped and grasper.

original: rtog pa yid la byed pa de ni brjod pa'i 'du shes kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa yid la byed pa de ni brjod pa'i 'du shes kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That conceptual mental attention is completely imbued with the notion of verbal description.

original: don gyi med dang yod pa ste //
analyzed: don gyi med dang yod pa ste //
translated: The non-existence and existence of the object

original: sgyu ma la sogs bzhin du 'dod //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs bzhin du 'dod //
translated: are accepted as being like an illusion, etc.

original: @22b de ni mi 'phro ma log ste //
analyzed: @22b de ni mi 'phro ma log ste //
translated: It is not dispersed and not reversed,

original: yod dang med pa mi 'phro'i phyir //
analyzed: yod dang med pa mi 'phro'i phyir //
translated: because the non-existence and existence are not dispersed.

original: don gyi med pa dang yod pa gong du bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa de ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod de /
analyzed: don gyi med pa dang yod pa gong du bshad ma thag pa gang yin pa de ni sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod de /
translated: The non-existence and existence of the object, which have just been explained, are accepted as being like an illusion, etc.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa'i dngos por yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i glang po che la sogs pa'i dngos por yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: For example, the entity of an illusory elephant, etc. does not exist,

original: de'i 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no ;
translated: but it is not non-existent because of the existence of the mere error of that.

original: ; de bzhin du don kyang ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ltar yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ; de bzhin du don kyang ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ltar yod pa ma yin la /
translated: In the same way, the object does not exist as it appears as the grasped and grasper,üîΩbut it is not non-existent because of the existence of the mere error of that.

original: de la 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa tsam du yod pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent, because it exists as mere error.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang chu zla la sogs pa'i dpe rnams te ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang chu zla la sogs pa'i dpe rnams te ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refer to the examples of the mirage, dream, moon in water, and so on, which should be understood as appropriate.

original: de ltar don la sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur mthong nas sems mi 'phro bar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar don la sgyu ma la sogs pa lta bur mthong nas sems mi 'phro bar mthong ba gang yin pa de ni mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: Thus, having seen that the object is like an illusion and so on, the mind does not move. This is the absence of error with respect to non-movement.

original: des yod pa dang med pa la sems 'phro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des yod pa dang med pa la sems 'phro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind does not move toward existence and nonexistence.

original: rtog pa thams cad mi 'jug phyir //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad mi 'jug phyir //
translated: Because all conceptualization does not operate,

original: thams cad ming tsam kho na ste //
analyzed: thams cad ming tsam kho na ste //
translated: everything is mere name.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma log pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma log pa'o //
translated: The intrinsic identity is not negated.

original: gang 'di mig dang gzugs rnams nas /
analyzed: gang 'di mig dang gzugs rnams nas /
translated: As for the eye and forms, up to

original: yid dang chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag thams cad ni ming tsam mo zhes de ltar gang shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pas 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: yid dang chos rnams zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag thams cad ni ming tsam mo zhes de ltar gang shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pas 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: All this, up to the mind and mental objects, is mere name. The knowledge that this is so is the antidote to all conceptual thoughts. This is the absence of error with regard to the own-characteristic.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gang la zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gang la zhe na /
translated: What is the own-characteristic?

original: don dam rang gi mtshan nyid la'o //
analyzed: don dam rang gi mtshan nyid la'o //
translated: The ultimate is the own-characteristic.

original: kun rdzob tu ni 'di ming tsam mo zhes 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni 'di ming tsam mo zhes 'dzin pa med do //
translated: But it is not apprehended as mere name in the conventional.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the dharma-element

original: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos yod ma yin te //
translated: there is no dharma whatsoever.

original: de'i phyir spyi yi mtshan nyid der //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi yi mtshan nyid der //
translated: Therefore, the universal characteristic

original: de ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de ni phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: is the absence of error with regard to that.

original: chos la bdag med pa las ma gtogs par chos gang med de /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa las ma gtogs par chos gang med de /
translated: Apart from the selflessness of dharmas, there is no dharma whatsoever.

original: de bas na chos kyi dbyings ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi dbyings ni chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the dharma-element is the universal characteristic of all dharmas. The knowledge that this is so is the absence of error with regard to the universal characteristic.

original: phyin ci log gi yid la byed //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi yid la byed //
translated: And the mind is perverted.

original: ma spangs pa dang spangs pa las //üîΩde ni ma dag rnam dag ste //
analyzed: ma spangs pa dang spangs pa las // de ni ma dag rnam dag ste //
translated: 1. The non-relinquishment and relinquishment of the inverted mental activity.üîΩ2. The non-purification and purification of the Dharma-element.

original: de yang de la ma log pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de la ma log pa'o //
translated: 3. The non-error and error with regard to that.

original: phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa ma spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings de rnam par ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi yid la byed pa ma spangs pa ni chos kyi dbyings de rnam par ma dag pa'o //
translated: The non-relinquishment of the inverted mental activity is the non-purification of the Dharma-element.

original: spangs pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par ma dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: spangs pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par ma dag pa dang / rnam par dag pa la phyin ci ma log pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: The relinquishment of it is the purification of it. The knowledge of it in this way is the non-error with regard to the non-purification and purification, respectively.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: The Dharma-element is naturally

original: rnam par dag phyir nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: rnam par dag phyir nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: pure like space,

original: gnyis ni glo bur byung ba ste //
analyzed: gnyis ni glo bur byung ba ste //
translated: and the two are adventitious.

original: de yang de la ma @23a * //
analyzed: de yang de la ma @23a * //
translated: And that is not in it.

original: log pa'o // chos kyi dbyings ni nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par ma dag pa dang / phyis rnam par dag ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyang glo bur yin par de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni glo bur du byung ba nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'o // chos kyi dbyings ni nam mkha' bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par ma dag pa dang / phyis rnam par dag ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyang glo bur yin par de ltar shes pa gang yin pa de ni glo bur du byung ba nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that it is so is the non-distortion with regard to the adventitious.üîΩThere is no defilement or purification

original: chos rnams dang ni gang zag gi / kun nas nyon mongs rnam dag med //
analyzed: chos rnams dang ni gang zag gi / kun nas nyon mongs rnam dag med //
translated: of dharmas or of a person.

original: med phyir de bas skrag dang nga //
analyzed: med phyir de bas skrag dang nga //
translated: Because of non-existence, there is no fear.

original: med de de 'dir ma log pa'o //
analyzed: med de de 'dir ma log pa'o //
translated: Non-existence is not distorted here.

original: gang zag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas rnam par dag pa med do //
analyzed: gang zag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa med pas rnam par dag pa med do //
translated: There is no purification of a person because of the non-existence of defilement.

original: chos kyi yang med de /
analyzed: chos kyi yang med de /
translated: Nor is there of dharmas.

original: 'di ltar gang zag med cing chos med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag med cing chos med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-existence of a person and the non-existence of dharmas.

original: gang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yang med cing rnam par byang ba yang med pa de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la su yang 'grib pa yang med la /
analyzed: gang gi kun nas nyon mongs pa gang yang med cing rnam par byang ba yang med pa de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs la su yang 'grib pa yang med la /
translated: Because there is no defilement of anyone and no purification of anything, therefore there is no diminution of anyone on the side of defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la su'i khyad par du 'gyur ba'ang med na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs la su'i khyad par du 'gyur ba'ang med na /
translated: Since there is no distinction in the sphere of purification,

original: de'i phyir skrag pa'am nga rgyal du gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skrag pa'am nga rgyal du gyur te /
translated: there is no reason for fear or pride.

original: 'di ni skrag pa med pa dang // khengs pa med pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skrag pa med pa dang // khengs pa med pa la phyin ci ma log pa'o //
translated: This is the non-erroneous nature of fearlessness and non-arrogance.

original: phyin ci ma log pa bcu po 'di dag ni rdo rje'i tshig bcu po dag dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa bcu po 'di dag ni rdo rje'i tshig bcu po dag dang go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: These ten non-erroneous natures should be applied in order to the ten vajra statements.

original: rdo rje'i tshig bcu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig bcu po 'di dag ni /
translated: These ten vajra statements are:

original: yod pa dang med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / gnas dang / sgyu ma lta bu nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / gnas dang / sgyu ma lta bu nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang /
translated: existence and non-existence, non-erroneous, basis, illusoriness, non-conceptuality, natural luminosity, affliction and purification,

original: nam mkha' lta bu dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa med pa'o //
translated: space-like, non-decrease, and non-distinction.

original: rdo rje'i tshig rnams kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa ni ngo bo nyid de ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum dang dmigs pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / brgal ba dang / lan te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig rnams kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa ni ngo bo nyid de ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum dang dmigs pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / brgal ba dang / lan te /
translated: The body of the vajra statements is the nature, which is threefold: the object of observation, nonconceptuality, and the replies to objections.

original: rdo rje'i tshig lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig lhag ma rnams so //
translated: The remaining vajra statements are the replies to objections.

original: lus rnam par gzhag pa gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: lus rnam par gzhag pa gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second body is the vajra statements:

original: gang la gang zhig gang gis 'khrul //
analyzed: gang la gang zhig gang gis 'khrul //
translated: What is the error of what in what?üîΩWhat is the non-error of what in what?

original: ma 'khrul gang zhig gang la dang // 'khrul dang ma 'khrul 'bras bu nyid //
analyzed: ma 'khrul gang zhig gang la dang // 'khrul dang ma 'khrul 'bras bu nyid //
translated: The result of error and non-error

original: de gnyis kyi ni mtha' ma'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi ni mtha' ma'o //
translated: is the end of those two.

original: rdo rje'i tshig rnams kyis bsdus pa'i don ni ngo bo nyid gsum ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig rnams kyis bsdus pa'i don ni ngo bo nyid gsum ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: The meaning subsumed by the vajra statements is the three natures, which are the object of observation.

original: yongs su grub pa dang / kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba dag ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa dang / kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba dag ste /
translated: They are called the thoroughly established, the imputed, and the dependent.

original: tshig dang po gsum dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: tshig dang po gsum dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are the first three statements, respectively.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni gang gis rnam par mi rtog ce na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni gang gis rnam par mi rtog ce na /
translated: Nonconceptuality is by what?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: It is by nonconceptual exalted wisdom.

original: gang la rnam par @23b mi rtog ce na /
analyzed: gang la rnam par @23b mi rtog ce na /
translated: What is it that is non-conceptual?

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid la'o //üîΩde bas na 'dis shes pa dang / shes pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid la'o // de bas na 'dis shes pa dang / shes pa rnam par gzhag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the natural luminosity.üîΩTherefore, this knowledge and this arrangement of knowledge should be understood in order, as follows:

original: ngo bo nyid gsum dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum dang / rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: the three natures and non-conceptuality.

original: brgal ba dang / lan ni lhag ma rnams so zhes bya ba de la brgal ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: brgal ba dang / lan ni lhag ma rnams so zhes bya ba de la brgal ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The remaining verses are the objections and replies.

original: gal te kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos de dag med na ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid kyi chos de dag med na ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur /
translated: Here is the objection: If those phenomena with the characteristics of the imagined and the other-dependent do not exist, how can they be apprehended?

original: ci ste yod na de lta na go chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yod na de lta na go chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid du mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: If they do exist, then it is not tenable that phenomena are naturally luminous.

original: de'i lan ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid yin te /
translated: The reply is that they are like illusions.

original: dper na sgyu ma byas pa ni med kyang dmigs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma byas pa ni med kyang dmigs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, an illusion is created and does not exist, yet it is apprehended.

original: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid yin na ji ltar sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa phyis rnam par byang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chos rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba nyid yin na ji ltar sngar kun nas nyon mongs pa phyis rnam par byang zhe na /
translated: If phenomena are by nature clear light, how can they be defiled at first and then purified?

original: de'i lan ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nam mkha' lta bur reg pa bya ba yin te /üîΩdper na nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: de'i lan ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba nam mkha' lta bur reg pa bya ba yin te / dper na nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: The answer is that defilement and purification are like space.

original: rnam par byang ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, space is naturally pure, and yet one says that it is defiled and purified.

original: gal te sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa byung ste /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa byung ste /
translated: If countless buddhas appear

original: sems can dpag tu med pa dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal na /
analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pa dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa bsal na /
translated: and remove the defilements of countless sentient beings,

original: de'i phyir ci ltar 'khor ba rgyun chad par mi 'gyur zhing mya ngan las 'das pa 'phel bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci ltar 'khor ba rgyun chad par mi 'gyur zhing mya ngan las 'das pa 'phel bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is it that cyclic existence is not terminated and how is it that nirvana does not increase?

original: de'i lan ni 'grib pa med pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i lan ni 'grib pa med pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa med pa nyid yin te /
translated: The answer is that there is no decrease and no increase.

original: sems can gyi khams dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the realms of sentient beings and the factors of purification are infinite.üîΩNon-erroneous existence and non-existence,

original: yod med phyin ci ma log dang // gnas dang sgyu ma lta bu nyid //
analyzed: yod med phyin ci ma log dang // gnas dang sgyu ma lta bu nyid //
translated: the state of illusion,

original: mi rtog pa dang rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: mi rtog pa dang rang bzhin gyis //
translated: non-imagination,

original: rtag par 'od gsal nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rtag par 'od gsal nyid dang ni //
translated: natural luminosity,üîΩdefilement and purification,

original: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang dang // de bzhin nam mkha' lta bu nyid //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs rnam byang dang // de bzhin nam mkha' lta bu nyid //
translated: and the state of space,

original: 'grib pa med dang lhag med pa //
analyzed: 'grib pa med dang lhag med pa //
translated: non-decrease and non-increase,

original: rdo rje'i tshig ni bcu zhes bya //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig ni bcu zhes bya //
translated: are the ten vajra statements.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa bshad zin te //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa bshad zin te //
translated: The practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma has been explained.

original: mtha' gnyis spang ba bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spang ba bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of avoiding the two extremes?

original: gang dkon mchog brtsegs pa las dbu ma'i lam bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gang dkon mchog brtsegs pa las dbu ma'i lam bshad pa'o //
translated: It is the explanation of the middle way in the Heap of Jewels.

original: mtha' gang dang gang spangs pas de rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' gang dang gang spangs pas de rig par bya zhe na /
translated: By avoiding which extremes should it be understood?üîΩThe extremes of difference and identity,üîΩthe two extremes of the tƒ´rthikas and ≈õrƒÅvakas,

original: tha dad pa dang gcig mtha' dang // mu stegs nyan thos gnyis ka dang // gang zag chos la sgro 'dogs dang // skur 'debs mtha' @24a * //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang gcig mtha' dang // mu stegs nyan thos gnyis ka dang // gang zag chos la sgro 'dogs dang // skur 'debs mtha' @24a * //
translated: the extremes of superimposition and denialüîΩwith regard to persons and phenomena,

original: rnams gnyis gnyis dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po'i mtha' //
analyzed: rnams gnyis gnyis dang // mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po'i mtha' //
translated: The extremes of the two, and of the adverse and counteragent,üîΩThe notion of permanence and annihilation,

original: rtag dang chad par 'du shes dang // gzung dang 'dzin dang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: rtag dang chad par 'du shes dang // gzung dang 'dzin dang kun nyon mongs //
translated: The grasped and grasper, and the defilement and purification,

original: rnam par byang la gnyis dang gsum //
analyzed: rnam par byang la gnyis dang gsum //
translated: The two and the three,

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi mtha' //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi mtha' //
translated: The extremes of the two discriminations,

original: de ni rnam pa bdun du 'dod //üîΩdngos yod dngos med zhi byed dang // zhi byed skrag bya de la 'jigs //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bdun du 'dod // dngos yod dngos med zhi byed dang // zhi byed skrag bya de la 'jigs //
translated: Are considered to be of seven kinds.üîΩThe existence and non-existence of things, the pacification and non-pacification,

original: gzung dang 'dzin dang yang dag nyid //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin dang yang dag nyid //
translated: The fear of pacification, the fear of that,üîΩThe grasped and grasper, the real and the unreal,

original: log pa nyid dang byed dang min //
analyzed: log pa nyid dang byed dang min //
translated: The performance and non-performance,

original: skye ba med dang mnyam pa'i dus //
analyzed: skye ba med dang mnyam pa'i dus //
translated: The non-production and the time of equality,

original: de ni rnam rtog gnyis kyi mtha' //
analyzed: de ni rnam rtog gnyis kyi mtha' //
translated: Are the extremes of the two discriminations.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa dang bdag tha dad ces bya ba yang mtha'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa dang bdag tha dad ces bya ba yang mtha'o //
translated: The difference of form, etc. and the self is an extreme.

original: gcig ces bya ba yang mtha'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba yang mtha'o //
translated: The identity is an extreme.

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is the avoidance of those,

original: gang bdag med par so sor rtog pa nas shed bu med par so sor rtog pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang bdag med par so sor rtog pa nas shed bu med par so sor rtog pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The discrimination of selflessness, etc. up to the discrimination of the non-existence of an agent.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan pa dang / srog de nyid lus de yin zhes bya bar lta ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni srog kyang gzhan la lus kyang gzhan pa dang / srog de nyid lus de yin zhes bya bar lta ba yin no //
translated: The view of self is the view that the life force is one thing and the body is another, or that the life force itself is the body.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rtag go zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rtag go zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi mtha'o //
translated: The extreme of permanence is the belief that form and so on are permanent.

original: mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: mi rtag go zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi mtha'o //
translated: The extreme of annihilation is the belief that they are impermanent.

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is the avoidance of those two extremes.

original: gang gzugs la sogs pa la rtag par yang mi rtog / mi rtag par yang mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs la sogs pa la rtag par yang mi rtog / mi rtag par yang mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the non-conceptualization of form and so on as either permanent or impermanent.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni gang zag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'o //üîΩbdag med ces bya ba ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni gang zag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'o // bdag med ces bya ba ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The extreme of imputation is the belief in a self.üîΩThe extreme of denial is the belief in selflessness.

original: brtags pa'i yod pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i yod pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a denial of the existence of the self as an imputation.

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is the avoidance of those two extremes.

original: gang bdag dang bdag med pa gnyis kyi dbus ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang bdag dang bdag med pa gnyis kyi dbus ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid do //
translated: It is the non-conceptualization of both a self and selflessness.

original: sems yang dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: sems yang dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos la sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The mind is real is the extreme of superimposition with respect to phenomena.

original: sems yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: sems yang dag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The mind is unreal is the extreme of denial.

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is the avoidance of those two extremes.

original: gang la sems med pa dang / sems pa med pa dang / yid med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la sems med pa dang / sems pa med pa dang / yid med pa dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'o //
translated: It is where there is no mind, no intention, no mental activity, and no consciousness.

original: mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtha'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtha'o //
translated: Unwholesome dharmas, etc. are the extreme of defilement.

original: dge ba la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i mtha'o //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'i mtha'o //
translated: Wholesome dharmas, etc. are the extreme of purification.

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is the avoidance of those two extremes.

original: gang mtha' de gnyis khas mi len zhing mi brjod cing mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: gang mtha' de gnyis khas mi len zhing mi brjod cing mi smra ba'o //
translated: It is where one does not accept, does not declare, and does not say that those two extremes exist.

original: @24b gang zag dang chos yod do zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: @24b gang zag dang chos yod do zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The existence of the person and of phenomena is the extreme of eternalism.

original: med do zhes bya ba ni chad pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba ni chad pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Nonexistence is the extreme of annihilationism.

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is for the purpose of abandoning those two extremes.

original: mtha' de gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the middle between those two extremes.

original: ma rig pa la gzung ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la gzung ba'o //
translated: Ignorance is the extreme of the apprehended.

original: 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtha' ste /
translated: The extreme of the apprehender is the same.

original: de bzhin du rig pa dang 'du byed rnams dang / de'i gnyen po 'dus ma byas dang / rga shi'i bar la gzung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig pa dang 'du byed rnams dang / de'i gnyen po 'dus ma byas dang / rga shi'i bar la gzung ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the extreme of the apprehended is from consciousness to compositional activity, and the extreme of the apprehender is from the antidote to compositional activity, the unconditioned, up to aging and death.

original: 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba yang mtha'o //üîΩde 'gog pa la gzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba yang mtha'o // de 'gog pa la gzung ba'o //
translated: The extreme of the apprehended is the same.

original: 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i zhes bya ba yang mtha' ste /
translated: The extreme of the apprehender is the same.üîΩThe middle way is for the purpose of abandoning those two extremes.

original: lam gang gis de 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: lam gang gis de 'gag pa'o //
translated: The middle way is the path by which those two are abandoned.

original: de bzhin du nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs kyi bye brag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs kyi bye brag gis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtha' rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Similarly, the extremes of the apprehended and the apprehender are twofold, distinguished by the categories of the dark and light sides.

original: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: de yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is for the purpose of abandoning those two extremes.

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa 'di ni gnyis su med ces rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa 'di ni gnyis su med ces rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúConsciousness and ignorance are not a duality. ‚Äù

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa la sogs pa la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because there is no duality in the form of object and subject in the case of consciousness and ignorance, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of defilement:

original: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: defilement by the passions, defilement by action, and defilement by birth.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Defilement by the passions is threefold:

original: lta ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu dang / yang srid pa la smon pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rgyu dang / yang srid pa la smon pa'o //
translated: the cause of passion, the cause of hatred, and the cause of folly, and the wish for renewed existence.

original: de'i gnyen po ni stong pa nyid shes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa dang / smon pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni stong pa nyid shes pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i shes pa dang / smon pa med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The antidote to these is the knowledge of emptiness, the knowledge of signlessness, and the knowledge of wishlessness.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa'o//
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mngon par 'du byed pa'o//
translated: Defilement by action is the performance of good and bad actions.

original: de'i gnyen po ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni mngon par 'du mi byed pa shes pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the knowledge of non-performance.

original: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yang srid par skye ba dang / skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig re re la byung ba dang / yang srid pa'i rgyun to //
analyzed: skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni yang srid par skye ba dang / skyes pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skad cig re re la byung ba dang / yang srid pa'i rgyun to //
translated: The defilement of birth is the birth of a new existence, the arising of each moment of mind and mental factors in the birth, and the continuity of the new existence.

original: de'i gnyen po ni skya ba med pa shes pa dang / 'byung ba med pa shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni skya ba med pa shes pa dang / 'byung ba med pa shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa shes pa'o //
translated: The counteragents to these are the knowledge of non-birth, the knowledge of non-appearance and the knowledge of intrinsic realitylessness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa de gsum dang bral ba ni rnam par byang ba'o //üîΩde la stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pas shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag dang ci @25a * //üîΩrigs par stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i bar du mi byed kyi /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa de gsum dang bral ba ni rnam par byang ba'o // de la stong pa nyid shes pa la sogs pas shes bya stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum po de dag dang ci @25a * // rigs par stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i bar du mi byed kyi /
translated: The purification is the freedom from these three kinds of defilement.üîΩIn this respect, the knowledge of emptiness etc. does not cause the dharmas of the object of knowledge, i.e. emptiness etc. to become defiled in any way by the three kinds of defilement, as is appropriate.

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sogs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la sogs te /
translated: However, it causes them to become purified by the three kinds of purification, as is appropriate.

original: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du ma gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the dharmadhƒÅtu is essentially undefiled.

original: gal te chos kyi dbyings kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi dbyings kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa'am /
translated: If one imagines that the dharma-dhƒÅtu is defiled or

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa 'di ni mtha' ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o snyam du rnam par rtog pa 'di ni mtha' ste /
translated: purified, this is an extreme.

original: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no defilement or purification in that which is not naturally defiled.

original: mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is for the purpose of avoiding those two extremes.

original: gang stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong par mi byed kyi chos rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid kyis chos rnams stong par mi byed kyi chos rnams nyid kyis stong pa'i zhes 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúEmptiness does not cause phenomena to be empty, but rather phenomena themselves are empty.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis rnam par bdun te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' gnyis rnam par bdun te /
translated: Moreover, there are seven kinds of extremes of conceptual thought.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dngos po yod par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conceptual thought that things exist is an extreme.

original: dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conceptual thought that things do not exist is an extreme.

original: gang zag yang de de gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang zag yang de de gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is for the purpose of destroying those two extremes.

original: yang na bdag med pa yang med do snyam du rtog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na bdag med pa yang med do snyam du rtog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, it is because of the idea that the non-self also does not exist.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' 'di gnyis spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' 'di gnyis spang ba'i phyir dbu ma'i lam ste /
translated: The middle way is for the purpose of avoiding these two extremes of conceptual differentiation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gang zag rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ma yin gyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: gang zag rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid ma yin gyi stong pa nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: It is not that emptiness is for the purpose of destroying the personal entity, but rather, emptiness is for the purpose of destroying the notion of the personal entity.üîΩIt is stated:

original: sngon gyi mtha' stong pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba'o //üîΩzhi bar bya ba rnam pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' stong pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba'o // zhi bar bya ba rnam pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The past is empty, the future is empty, and so on at length.üîΩThe pacification of the personal entity is an extreme,

original: zhi bar byed pa rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: zhi bar byed pa rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
translated: and the pacification of emptiness is also an extreme.

original: spang bar bya ba dang / spong bar byed pa rnam par rtog pas stong pa nyid kyis skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba dang / spong bar byed pa rnam par rtog pas stong pa nyid kyis skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the fear of emptiness due to the conceptual differentiation of the abandonment and the one who abandons.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe nam mkha'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe nam mkha'o //
translated: Space is the example for the purpose of avoiding these two extremes of conceptual differentiation.üîΩThe conceptual differentiation of the object of fear is an extreme,

original: skrag par bya bar rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: skrag par bya bar rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: and the conceptual differentiation of the fear itself is also an extreme.

original: skrag par bya ba de las 'jigs par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: skrag par bya ba de las 'jigs par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
translated: The fear of that which is to be feared is also an extreme,

original: sdug bsngal gyis khong dang ngas pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis khong dang ngas pas kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the fear of the imagined form, etc. , due to being filled with suffering.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe ni ri mo mkhan no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe ni ri mo mkhan no //
translated: The artist is the example for the avoidance of those two extremes of conceptualization.

original: dpe snga ma ni nyan thos rnams las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: dpe snga ma ni nyan thos rnams las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The previous example is in terms of the disciples.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams las brtsams pa'o //üîΩgzung bar rnam par @25b rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams las brtsams pa'o // gzung bar rnam par @25b rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: This one is in terms of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe conceptualization of the apprehended is an extreme.

original: 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conceptualization of the apprehender is also an extreme.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe sgyu ma mkhan no //üîΩrnam par rig pa tsam du shes pas don dngos po med par byas nas //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe sgyu ma mkhan no // rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pas don dngos po med par byas nas //
translated: The magician is the example for the avoidance of those two extremes of conceptualization.üîΩHaving made the nonexistence of the object by the knowledge that it is representation-only,

original: don dngos po med par shes pa des kyang rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pa de nyid rnam par bzlog go //
analyzed: don dngos po med par shes pa des kyang rnam par rig pa tsam du shes pa de nyid rnam par bzlog go //
translated: by that knowledge of the nonexistence of the object, that very knowledge that it is representation-only is also eliminated.

original: don dngos po med na rnam par rig pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dngos po med na rnam par rig pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: If the object does not exist, consciousness is impossible.

original: de ltar na 'di ni 'dir mtshungs so //üîΩyang dag pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni 'dir mtshungs so // yang dag pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: Thus, this is similar to that.üîΩConceptualizing reality is an extreme.

original: log pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: log pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
translated: Conceptualizing unreality is an extreme.

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa na yang dag pa nyid du'am /
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa na yang dag pa nyid du'am /
translated: When one examines reality, one conceptualizes either reality or

original: log pa nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: log pa nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: unreality.

original: mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe shing gnyis las me 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe shing gnyis las me 'byung ba ste /
translated: In order to avoid these two extremes, the example of fire arising from two sticks is given.

original: dper na me'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa shing gnyis las med 'byung ste /
analyzed: dper na me'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa shing gnyis las med 'byung ste /
translated: For example, fire arises from two sticks that do not have the characteristics of fire.

original: byung nas kyang shing gnyis tshig par byed do //
analyzed: byung nas kyang shing gnyis tshig par byed do //
translated: Having arisen, it burns up the two sticks.

original: de bzhin du yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa las yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po skye ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog pa las yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po skye ste /
translated: In the same way, the noble faculty of wisdom, which has the characteristics of reality, arises from the correct discrimination of reality, which does not have the characteristics of reality.

original: skyes nas kyang yang dag par so sor rtog pa de nyid rnam par 'jig par byed de /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang yang dag par so sor rtog pa de nyid rnam par 'jig par byed de /
translated: And having arisen, it is destroyed by that very correct analytical discrimination.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni 'dir mtshungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni 'dir mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, this is similar to that.

original: yang dag par so sor rtog pa yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin kyang log pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par so sor rtog pa yang dag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid ma yin kyang log pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Correct analytical discrimination is not the characteristic of reality, nor is it the characteristic of unreality,

original: yang dag pa nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbyed pa rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro // byed pa rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: because it is in conformity with reality.üîΩThe conceptualization of activity is an extreme.

original: mi byed par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: mi byed par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
translated: The conceptualization of inactivity is also an extreme.

original: ye shes ni blo sngon du 'gro bas byed pa'am mthu med par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes ni blo sngon du 'gro bas byed pa'am mthu med par rtog pa'o //
translated: Since wisdom precedes the mind, it is conceptualized as having activity or as having no power.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe mar me'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis yongs su spang ba'i phyir dpe mar me'o //
translated: The example of the lamp is for the purpose of avoiding these two extremes of conceptualization.

original: skye ba med par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
analyzed: skye ba med par rnam par rtog pa yang mtha'o //
translated: The conceptualization of non-arising is an extreme.

original: dus mnyam pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang mtha' ste /
translated: The conceptualization of simultaneity is also an extreme.

original: gal te gnyen po ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gnyen po ma skyes pa'am /
translated: If the antidote has not arisen,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yun ring ba nyid du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yun ring ba nyid du rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the idea that the defilements are eternal.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis spang ba'i phyir mar me'i dpe gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtha' de gnyis spang ba'i phyir mar me'i dpe gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second example of the lamp is for the purpose of avoiding these two extremes of conceptualization.

original: mtha' gnyis spang ba'i sgrub pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spang ba'i sgrub pa bshad zin to //
translated: The establishment of the avoidance of the two extremes has been explained.

original: khyad par can dang khyad par med pa sgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par can dang khyad par med pa sgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of the specific and the nonspecific?

original: khyad par can dang khyad med ni //üîΩsa bcu dag tu @26a * //
analyzed: khyad par can dang khyad med ni // sa bcu dag tu @26a * //
translated: The specific and the nonspecific

original: shes par bya //
analyzed: shes par bya //
translated: should be understood in the ten stages.

original: sa gang la pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi shas che ba de ni khyad par can no //
analyzed: sa gang la pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi shas che ba de ni khyad par can no //
translated: In whatever stage the perfection is predominant, that is the specific.

original: thams cad du thams cad la yang dag par bsgrub pa ni khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du thams cad la yang dag par bsgrub pa ni khyad par med pa'o //
translated: The correct practice in all and everything is the nonspecific.

original: bsgrub pa bla na med pa nyid bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsgrub pa bla na med pa nyid bshad zin to //
translated: The establishment of the supremacy of practice has been explained.

original: dmigs pa bla na med pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa bla na med pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supremacy of objective?

original: rnam par gzhag dang de bzhin dbyings //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag dang de bzhin dbyings //
translated: It is the establishment, the realm,üîΩthe practice, the practice itself, the grasping,

original: bsgrub dang sgrub dang 'dzin pa dang // nges par 'dzin dang rab tu 'dzin //
analyzed: bsgrub dang sgrub dang 'dzin pa dang // nges par 'dzin dang rab tu 'dzin //
translated: the firm grasping, and the full grasp.

original: rab tu rtogs dang rab rgyas dang // rnam par rtog dang rnal 'dug dang // phul du byung ba'i dmigs par 'dod //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs dang rab rgyas dang // rnam par rtog dang rnal 'dug dang // phul du byung ba'i dmigs par 'dod //
translated: The object of observation is considered to be of twelve kinds:

original: dmigs pa ni rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dang ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rnam pa bcu gnyis po 'di dang ste /
translated: The object of observation is considered to be of twelve kinds:

original: 'di ltar chos brtags pa rnam par gzhag pa'i dmigs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi dmigs pa dang / bsgrub bya'i dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa'i dmigs pa dang / 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos brtags pa rnam par gzhag pa'i dmigs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi dmigs pa dang / bsgrub bya'i dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa'i dmigs pa dang / 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang / nges par 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa dang /
translated: the object of observation for the establishment of the investigation of phenomena, the object of observation for the realm of phenomena, the object of observation for the goal, the object of observation for the means of attainment, the object of observation for retention, the object of observation for retention through ascertainment, the object of observation for retention through full apprehension,

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang / rab tu rgyas pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam par khong du chud pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnal du 'dug pa'i dmigs pa dang / phul du byung ba'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i dmigs pa dang / rab tu rgyas pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnam par khong du chud pa'i dmigs pa dang / rnal du 'dug pa'i dmigs pa dang / phul du byung ba'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: the object of observation for full understanding, the object of observation for full development, the object of observation for full comprehension, the object of observation for full pacification, and the object of observation for excellence.

original: de la dang po ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos gang dag rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos gang dag rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: The first is the phenomena such as the perfections that are established.

original: gnyis pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The second is suchness.

original: gang gsum pa dang bzhi pa de dag nyid la go rims bzhin te /üîΩchos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gsum pa dang bzhi pa de dag nyid la go rims bzhin te / chos kyi dbyings rab tu rtogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third and fourth are the objective supports of the first and second pure patiences, respectively.

original: lnga pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the objective support of the knowledge derived from hearing.

original: drug pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i ste rtogs nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drug pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i ste rtogs nas 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sixth is the objective support of the knowledge derived from reflection, because one grasps it after understanding it.

original: bdun pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i ste /
analyzed: bdun pa ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i ste /
translated: The seventh is the objective support of the knowledge derived from cultivation.

original: so so rang gis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so rang gis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one grasps it oneself.

original: brgyad pa ni sa dang po la mthong ba'i lam gyi'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni sa dang po la mthong ba'i lam gyi'o //
translated: The eighth is the objective support of the path of insight on the first stage.

original: dgu ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ste /
analyzed: dgu ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi ste /
translated: The ninth is the objective support of the path of cultivation,

original: sa bdun pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the seventh stage.

original: bcu pa ni de nyid la 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi ste /
analyzed: bcu pa ni de nyid la 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi ste /
translated: The tenth is the objective support of the mundane and supramundane paths on that stage,

original: chos rnam par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbcu gcig pa ni sa brgyad pa la'o //
analyzed: chos rnam par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro // bcu gcig pa ni sa brgyad pa la'o //
translated: because one understands the Dharma.üîΩThe eleventh is on the eighth stage.

original: bcu gnyis pa ni sa dgu pa la sogs pa gsum la'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa ni sa dgu pa la sogs pa gsum la'o //
translated: The twelfth is on the ninth stage, etc.

original: dang po'i gnyis po de dag ni de dang de'i dus na de dang de'i dmigs pa'i ming 'thob po //
analyzed: dang po'i gnyis po de dag ni de dang de'i dus na de dang de'i dmigs pa'i ming 'thob po //
translated: The first two of these are called by the name of their object at the time when they are the object of the path of insight.

original: dmigs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dmigs pa bshad zin to //
translated: The object has been explained.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is accomplishment?

original: ma tshang med dang mi spong dang // mi @26b g-yeng ba dang rab rdzogs pa dang // yang dag skyed dang 'phel ba dang // las su rung dang mi gnas dang // sgrib pa med pa nyid dang de //
analyzed: ma tshang med dang mi spong dang // mi @26b g-yeng ba dang rab rdzogs pa dang // yang dag skyed dang 'phel ba dang // las su rung dang mi gnas dang // sgrib pa med pa nyid dang de //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the absence of deficiency, of non-abandonment, of non-distraction, of complete achievement, of correct generation, of increase, of aptitude, of non-abiding, and of non-obscuration.

original: rgyun mi gcod pa yang dag 'grub //
analyzed: rgyun mi gcod pa yang dag 'grub //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the uninterrupted practice.

original: yang dag par 'grub pa ni rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: yang dag par 'grub pa ni rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ste /
translated: Accomplishment is of ten kinds:

original: de la rkyen mtshang ba med pa ni rigs yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la rkyen mtshang ba med pa ni rigs yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the spiritual gene is the accomplishment of the absence of deficiency of the equipment of virtue.

original: theg pa chen po mi spang ba ni mos pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po mi spang ba ni mos pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of devotion is the accomplishment of the non-abandonment of the universal vehicle.

original: theg pa dman par mi g-yeng ba ni sems bskyed pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa dman par mi g-yeng ba ni sems bskyed pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the creative will is the accomplishment of non-distraction in the individual vehicle.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsgrub pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsgrub pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of the practice is the complete achievement of the transcendences.

original: 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa ni skyon med par 'jug pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa ni skyon med par 'jug pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The generation of the noble path is the accomplishment of the entrance into the absence of fault.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba ni yun ring po nas 'dris par bya ba'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phel ba ni yun ring po nas 'dris par bya ba'i phyir sems can yongs su smin par byed pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The increase of the roots of virtue is the accomplishment of the development of living beings, because of the long acquaintance.

original: sems las su rung ba ni zhing yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: sems las su rung ba ni zhing yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The pliability of mind is the accomplishment of the purification of the field.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la lung bstan pa 'thob pa yang dag par 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la lung bstan pa 'thob pa yang dag par 'grub pa ste /
translated: The non-abiding in either cyclic life or in the nirvana is the accomplishment of the attainment of the prediction on the stage of non-regression,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the non-regression from either cyclic life or nirvana.

original: sgrib pa med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The absence of obscuration is the accomplishment of the stage of the Buddha.

original: de rgyun mi gcod pa ni byang chub kun du ston pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o //üîΩde ltar na 'di ni /
analyzed: de rgyun mi gcod pa ni byang chub kun du ston pa yang dag par 'grub pa'o // de ltar na 'di ni /
translated: The non-interruption of that is the accomplishment of the demonstration of enlightenment.

original: dbus rnam 'byed pa'i bstan bcos te //
analyzed: dbus rnam 'byed pa'i bstan bcos te //
translated: Thus, this is the treatise which discriminates the middle.

original: dbu ma'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the middle way.

original: 'di ni dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes,

original: dbus dang mthar gnyis rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus dang mthar gnyis rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it teaches the middle and the extremes.

original: yang na thog ma dang mtha' ma spangs pa'i dbus rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na thog ma dang mtha' ma spangs pa'i dbus rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it teaches the middle which is free from the beginning and end.

original: rtog par dka' dang snying po'i don //
analyzed: rtog par dka' dang snying po'i don //
translated: It is difficult to understand, and has the meaning of the essence,

original: rtog ke'i spyod yul ma yin pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba dag gis mi shigs pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog ke'i spyod yul ma yin pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba dag gis mi shigs pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: because it is not the domain of discursive thought, and because it cannot be destroyed by adversaries, respectively.

original: don chen ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi ched kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don chen ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi ched kyi phyir ro //
translated: It has a great meaning, because it is for the sake of the benefit of self and other.

original: de bzhin kun gyi don ni theg pa gsum char gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin kun gyi don ni theg pa gsum char gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has the meaning of all, because it is governed by all three vehicles.

original: don med thams cad sel ba'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: don med thams cad sel ba'o zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It removes all that is meaningless, because it eliminates the obscurations of afflictions and the knowable.

original: bla na med pa nyid kyi don bsdus pa ni mdor bsdu na bla na med pa nyid rnam gsum ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa nyid kyi don bsdus pa ni mdor bsdu na bla na med pa nyid rnam gsum ste /
translated: The summary of the meaning of supremacy is as follows: in brief, supremacy is threefold:

original: sgrub pa dang / bsgrub pa'i gzhi dang / bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / bsgrub pa'i gzhi dang / bsgrub pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: the practice, the basis of practice, and the result of practice.

original: bsgrub pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsgrub pa de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: And what is that practice like?üîΩIt is the highest.

original: dam pa'o // gang gis she na /
analyzed: dam pa'o // gang gis she na /
translated: By what?üîΩBy the Great Vehicle.

original: theg pa chen por ji lta bur //
analyzed: theg pa chen por ji lta bur //
translated: How?

original: @27a * // chos rnams rab tu bzhag pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: @27a * // chos rnams rab tu bzhag pa dag / ces bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By the arrangement of the teachings.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: rnam pa gang gis zhi gnas bsgom pa la g-yeng ba med par gyur pa dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa la phyin ci ma log par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis zhi gnas bsgom pa la g-yeng ba med par gyur pa dang / lhag mthong bsgom pa la phyin ci ma log par gyur ba'o //
translated: In the way that one becomes free from distraction in the practice of serenity and free from error in the practice of insight.

original: gang gi don du zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi don du zhe na /
translated: For whose sake?

original: dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of liberation by the middle way.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: sa bcu dag tu ste /
analyzed: sa bcu dag tu ste /
translated: In the ten stages.

original: khyad par can dang / khyad par med pa'o zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: khyad par can dang / khyad par med pa'o zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The stages are distinguished as special and non-special.

original: phyin ci ma log pa rnams kyi don bslus pa ni /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa rnams kyi don bslus pa ni /
translated: The meaning of non-error is not to be deceived.

original: yi ge la phyin ci ma log pas zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma rab tu rtogs pa dang / don la phyin ci ma log pas lhag mthong gi mtshan ma rab tu rtogs pa dang / yid la byed pa phyin ci ma log pas phyin ci log gi gzhi yongs su spong ba dang /
analyzed: yi ge la phyin ci ma log pas zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma rab tu rtogs pa dang / don la phyin ci ma log pas lhag mthong gi mtshan ma rab tu rtogs pa dang / yid la byed pa phyin ci ma log pas phyin ci log gi gzhi yongs su spong ba dang /
translated: Through unmistaken knowledge of the words, they fully understand the attributes of sustained calm. Through unmistaken knowledge of the meaning, they fully understand the attributes of profound insight. Through unmistaken knowledge of attentiveness, they completely eliminate the basis of error.

original: mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pas de'i mtshan ma legs par rtogs par byed pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pas de'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i lam bsgoms pa dang ; spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pas rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'phro ba la phyin ci ma log pas de'i mtshan ma legs par rtogs par byed pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pas de'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i lam bsgoms pa dang ; spyi'i mtshan nyid la phyin ci ma log pas rnam par byang ba'i rang bzhin du rab tu rtogs pa dang /
translated: Through unmistaken knowledge of nonconceptuality, they fully understand its attributes. Through unmistaken knowledge of its specific characteristics, they meditate on the antidote to that, the nonconceptual path. Through unmistaken knowledge of its general characteristics, they fully understand that it is by nature completely pure.

original: ma dag pa dang dag pa yid la byed pa la phyin ci ma log pas de'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa dang / spangs pa rab tu shes pa dang / de'i glo bur du byung ba la phyin ci ma log pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: ma dag pa dang dag pa yid la byed pa la phyin ci ma log pas de'i sgrib pa ma spangs pa dang / spangs pa rab tu shes pa dang / de'i glo bur du byung ba la phyin ci ma log pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: By being unmistaken about what is adventitious, one knows well the afflictions and purification.

original: mi skrag pa dang / khengs pa med pa la byin ci ma log pas sgrib pa med par nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi skrag pa dang / khengs pa med pa la byin ci ma log pas sgrib pa med par nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: By being unmistaken about fearlessness and non-arrogance, one attains the unobscured.

original: bshad pa'i 'di byas pa yi bsod nams gang yod des //
analyzed: bshad pa'i 'di byas pa yi bsod nams gang yod des //
translated: By whatever merit exists from having done this explanation,

original: 'gro ba bsod nams 'byung ba che dang ye shes kyang ;
analyzed: 'gro ba bsod nams 'byung ba che dang ye shes kyang ;
translated: may beings have great merit and wisdom,üîΩand may they be free from all obstacles.

original: /'byung bar gyur cig de las mngon mtho chen po dang // byang chub gsum yang 'gro bas myur du thob gyur cig / bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las theg pa bla na med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur bcad pa lnga ba'i 'grel ba'o /
analyzed: /'byung bar gyur cig de las mngon mtho chen po dang // byang chub gsum yang 'gro bas myur du thob gyur cig / bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las theg pa bla na med pa zhes bya ba'i tshig le'ur bcad pa lnga ba'i 'grel ba'o /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fifth chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Unsurpassed Vehicle,‚Äù of the root verses of Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes.

original: // / bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: // / bstan bcos dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i 'grel pa slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the treatise Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes composed by the master Vasubandhu.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po dzi na mi tra dang / sh'i lendra bo dhi dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba bande ye shes sdes bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o /
